translated: Here, the meaning of the reason “because it is not a human” is not established, as it is taught that the ultimate Tathāgata is not omniscient.

translated: This is because the Dharma body is free from the elaborations of humans and so on, and because the collection of supramundane, uncontaminated dharmas is not included in the three realms.

original: 'dis byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon dag kyang shes par bya zhing mi phal pa la sogs pa'i dpe'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon dag kyang shes par bya zhing mi phal pa la sogs pa'i dpe'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Through this, one should understand the faults of reasons such as “because it is a product,” and one should state the faults of examples such as “ordinary people” and so on.

original: ye shes kyi phyogs la yang rnam pa de nyid kyis gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon @214b dag dang / de'i gtan tshigs 'dzin pa nyid dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyogs la yang rnam pa de nyid kyis gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon @214b dag dang / de'i gtan tshigs 'dzin pa nyid dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the case of the aspect of gnosis, you should state the faults of the reason and example, and the faults of apprehending the reason and having an observation.

original: sku'i phyogs la yang gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon dag de bzhin no //
analyzed: sku'i phyogs la yang gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon dag de bzhin no //
translated: In the case of the aspect of body, the faults of the reason and example are the same.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no //
translated: You are not omniscient.

original: zhes dam bcas pa de'i don kyang re zhig gang yin /
analyzed: zhes dam bcas pa de'i don kyang re zhig gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of that thesis?

original: ci thams cad ni mi mkhyen la /🔽cung zad mkhyen pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci thams cad ni mi mkhyen la / cung zad mkhyen pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that you do not know everything,🔽that you know some things,

original: 'on te cung zad kyang mi mkhyen pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te cung zad kyang mi mkhyen pa yin /
translated: or that you know nothing at all?

original: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni des ci zhig mi mkhyen par 'dod /
analyzed: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni des ci zhig mi mkhyen par 'dod /
translated: If you assert the first option, what is it that you do not know?

original: gal te dbang po las 'das pa'o zhe na des de mkhyen te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po las 'das pa'o zhe na des de mkhyen te /
translated: If you say that it is beyond the senses, then you know it.

original: shes bya yin pa'i phyir nyid kyi phyag mthil du nor bu dri ma med pa la sogs pa bzhag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes bya yin pa'i phyir nyid kyi phyag mthil du nor bu dri ma med pa la sogs pa bzhag pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an object of knowledge, it is like a stainless jewel placed in the palm of your hand.

original: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / grags pas gnod de /
analyzed: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / grags pas gnod de /
translated: But if you maintain the latter alternative, then you are undermined by your own position and undermined by what is commonly acknowledged.

original: de ni mi yin pa'i phyir zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i dpe dag 'jig rten la grags pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi yin pa'i phyir zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i dpe dag 'jig rten la grags pas mi rung ste /
translated: Because you accept that he is a human being, and the examples of ordinary beings, etc., are not correct because they are commonly acknowledged in the world.

original: de dag gis kyang yul 'ga' zhig shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang yul 'ga' zhig shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they also know some objects.

original: ci ste gzhan dag gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar du gtogs pa dang / ma gtogs pa dag ji ltar shes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen to zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dag gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar du gtogs pa dang / ma gtogs pa dag ji ltar shes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen to zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that the Lord does not know the past, future, and present in the way that others know them, then you are proving what is already established,

original: de dag gi log pa'i shes pas shes bya dag log par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi log pa'i shes pas shes bya dag log par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their false knowledge knows objects falsely.

original: ci ste mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ci ste mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba /
translated: But if you say that he does not know,🔽then you are undermining what is commonly acknowledged in the world.

original: ngan pa mkhyen pa'o zhe na ni kho bo chag gi ston pa thams cad shes pa'o zhes sgrub pa rnams kyi rang gi ston pa dag gis gtan tshigs thams cad ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngan pa mkhyen pa'o zhe na ni kho bo chag gi ston pa thams cad shes pa'o zhes sgrub pa rnams kyi rang gi ston pa dag gis gtan tshigs thams cad ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that the bad is known, then our own teachers, the teachers of the Sāṃkhya, say, “All is known,” and all the reasons of the Sāṃkhyas are uncertain.

original: dpyod pa can dag gi ni rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: dpyod pa can dag gi ni rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: For the Vaiśeṣikas, the reasons are uncertain because of the Vaiśeṣikas’ own theories.

original: re zhig rab rib kyis zil gyis non pa de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig rab rib kyis zil gyis non pa de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
translated: First, those who are overcome by cataracts should be asked this:

original: gang gis shes bya gang gi ngo bo nyid shes pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis shes bya gang gi ngo bo nyid shes pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan par brjod par bya ste /
translated: “If one knows the nature of an object of knowledge, should one say that one possesses correct knowledge?”

original: de dag gal te 'di skad ces 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di'o zhes de dag grub pa'i mtha' yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag gal te 'di skad ces 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di'o zhes de dag grub pa'i mtha' yongs su bzung ste /
translated: If they say, “The nature of this is this,” and they hold their own tenets,

original: smra na dgag pa skabs ji ltar gsungs pa dag rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smra na dgag pa skabs ji ltar gsungs pa dag rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: then the refutations should be stated extensively, just as they are stated in the chapter on the worldly path.

original: gang dag mkhas par rlom pas 'khrul pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang dag mkhas par rlom pas 'khrul pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Those who are deluded by the conceit of being learned say,🔽“The nature of the object of knowledge is not known.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is not omniscient,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / mdzes ldan ma gsod pa ma sbrang pa'i phyir dang / bram ze'i bu mo dregs mas skur ba btab pa'i phyir dang / grong khyer dmar can @215a * //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / mdzes ldan ma gsod pa ma sbrang pa'i phyir dang / bram ze'i bu mo dregs mas skur ba btab pa'i phyir dang / grong khyer dmar can @215a * //
translated: because he did not declare the indeterminate things, because he did not foretell the murder of Sundari, because he did not foretell the death of the Brahman girl Dhatri, because he did not foretell the death of the son of the people of Mathura,

original: gyi bu 'jig pa ma nges pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / lhas byin rab tu phyung ba la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na mi phal pa bzhin no //🔽de dag gi yang dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas skyon ji skad bstan pa dag nyid brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: gyi bu 'jig pa ma nges pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes rang nyid mi shes par khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / lhas byin rab tu phyung ba la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na mi phal pa bzhin no // de dag gi yang dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas skyon ji skad bstan pa dag nyid brjod par bya zhing /
translated: because he did not know the beginning of samsara himself, because he did not declare it, and because he allowed Devadatta to go forth and so on, just like ordinary people.🔽The faults that were taught should be stated in the same way, after analyzing the meaning of their assertions.

original: gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon dag kyang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon dag kyang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The faults of the reason and example should be stated as appropriate.

original: ci ste thams cad du lung ma bstan pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs brjod na /
analyzed: ci ste thams cad du lung ma bstan pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs brjod na /
translated: If you say that the reason is because all is neutral,

original: de lta na yang rang gi ston pa dag gi ma nges pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang gi ston pa dag gi ma nges pa nyid yin pas /
translated: then your own teacher is not established.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa yin no zhes ba ga rkyong ste smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa yin no zhes ba ga rkyong ste smra bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should speak with confidence, saying, “The Tathagata is the one who knows without error.”

original: thams cad ces bya ba yang gang yin /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba yang gang yin /
translated: What is meant by “all”?

original: gal te srog la sogs pa dag gam /
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa dag gam /
translated: If it means the life-force and so on,

original: tshig gi don drug gi rdzas dag gam /
analyzed: tshig gi don drug gi rdzas dag gam /
translated: the six categories of substance,

original: gtso bo dang / skyes bu'o zhe na ni /
analyzed: gtso bo dang / skyes bu'o zhe na ni /
translated: or the primal substance and the person,

original: de dad de ltar ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dad de ltar ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: then since they do not exist in that way,

original: de dag thams cad nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad nyid ma yin no //
translated: they are not all.

original: ci ste spyi'o zhe na ni des de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du mkhyen te /
analyzed: ci ste spyi'o zhe na ni des de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du mkhyen te /
translated: If it means the general, then he knows it just as it is, that they are essenceless.

original: de ltar ni bstan kyang zin la ston par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni bstan kyang zin la ston par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is taught and will be taught.

original: dpyod pa can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some of the Analysts say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin te /🔽byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin te / byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: The scriptures of the Tathāgata were spoken by one who is not omniscient,

original: bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
analyzed: bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
translated: because they have an author, like, for example, the treatises of the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: de dag gi dam bcas pa'i don kyang rnam par brtags nas snga ma bzhin du skyon brjod par bya'o //🔽rig byed ni byed pa po dan bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi dam bcas pa'i don kyang rnam par brtags nas snga ma bzhin du skyon brjod par bya'o // rig byed ni byed pa po dan bcas pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of their thesis should be analyzed, and the error should be stated as before.🔽The Vedas have an author, because they are read, like, for example, the treatises of the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: klag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bye brag la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin pas rig byed kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: klag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bye brag la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin pas rig byed kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the reason, “because the Vedas have an author,” is not established.

original: ci ste rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say, “The words of the Vedas are not created,

original: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because we do not remember their author,”

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is not good,

original: gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to demonstrate the pervasion of the reason.

original: lung las / nges brjod ni ri bo nges pa zhes bya bar byas la /🔽snyan tshigs dag ni ri bo snyan pa zhes bya bar byas /
analyzed: lung las / nges brjod ni ri bo nges pa zhes bya bar byas la / snyan tshigs dag ni ri bo snyan pa zhes bya bar byas /
translated: The Nighantu was composed on the mountain called Niṣadha,🔽the Nirukta was composed on the mountain called Śṛṅga,

original: srid srung nyi ma'i rgyud ni ri bo skal ldan bug ron can du byas so zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: srid srung nyi ma'i rgyud ni ri bo skal ldan bug ron can du byas so zhes 'byung bas /
translated: and the Śrautasūtra was composed on the mountain called Bhadrāśva.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don rang la ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don rang la ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established for you.

original: gal te gsal ba dag gi skyon med do zhe na /🔽phyogs des kyang mi nus te /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba dag gi skyon med do zhe na / phyogs des kyang mi nus te /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established for the opponent,

original: gsal ba snga ma bzhin @215b du dgag pa'i phyir ro //🔽rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba snga ma bzhin @215b du dgag pa'i phyir ro // rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa yin te /
translated: that is not possible because the previous position is refuted.

original: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Veda statements are created because they are taught in order to easily understand the meaning that is desired to be known.

original: dper na grangs can gyi bstan bcos kyi tshig dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grangs can gyi bstan bcos kyi tshig dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statements of the Sāṃkhya treatise.

original: de bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i yan lag lhag ma dag 'dod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / gzung ba nyid dang ; brjod par bya ba nyid dang / don dang ldan pa nyid dang / chos sgrub pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i yan lag lhag ma dag 'dod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / gzung ba nyid dang ; brjod par bya ba nyid dang / don dang ldan pa nyid dang / chos sgrub pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should state the inference extensively, saying: “The words of the scriptures are valid because they are desired, because they are apprehended, because they are expressed, because they have meaning, because they are the practice of Dharma, and so on.”

original: dpyod pa can dag gis rab tu brtag pa'i sgra la ni sgra'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: dpyod pa can dag gis rab tu brtag pa'i sgra la ni sgra'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: The sound that is imagined by the logicians does not have the nature of sound,

original: dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no //
translated: because it is apprehended by the sense faculties, like form.

original: sgra ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /🔽rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: sgra ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin te / rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Sound is not that which is manifested,

original: yan lag gi rgyu las bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag gi rgyu las bzhin no //
translated: because it is the cause of understanding, like the cause of the parts.

original: de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang / chos sgrub pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyud la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang / chos sgrub pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyud la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should elaborate the inference: “Because of the reason of existence, of the expressible, of the knowable, of the establishment of the teaching, of pleasure, of the series of the tormented, etc.”

original: 'dis sngon ma byung ba'i lha nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis sngon ma byung ba'i lha nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this refutes the opinion of those who say that the Veda is self-evident, not produced by an author.

original: rig byed ni byed pa po tshul khrims 'chal pas byas par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rig byed ni byed pa po tshul khrims 'chal pas byas par shes par bya ste /
translated: The Veda is the work of an immoral person,

original: 'tshe ba dang / bgrod par bya ba ma yin par 'gro ba dang / chang 'thung ba chos su ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'tshe ba dang / bgrod par bya ba ma yin par 'gro ba dang / chang 'thung ba chos su ston pa'i phyir /
translated: because it teaches violence, intercourse with the wife of another, lying, theft, and the drinking of alcohol.

original: dper na par sig la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na par sig la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
translated: Like the treatises of the Pārasīkas, etc.

original: gal te bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i tshe ba ni chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i tshe ba ni chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the violence taught in the Veda is not immoral,

original: gsang sngags kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is protected by the mantra.

original: dper na dug za ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na dug za ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: It is like eating poison.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it is not certain that one will go to a miserable realm through stealing, sexual misconduct, etc.

original: 'tshe ba ni ngan 'gro'i rgyu'i yin te /
analyzed: 'tshe ba ni ngan 'gro'i rgyu'i yin te /
translated: Violence is the cause of going to a miserable realm,

original: bsams bzhin du ma nor ba gsod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du ma nor ba gsod pa'i phyir /
translated: because one kills intentionally and without error.

original: dper na tha mal par phyugs gsod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tha mal par phyugs gsod pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like killing cattle in a normal way.

original: yang na mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: yang na mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Or else, the activity characterized by violence in the place of sacrifice is the cause of going to a miserable realm,

original: gzhan gsod par rjes su gnang ba sngon du btang ba nyid yin na bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: gzhan gsod par rjes su gnang ba sngon du btang ba nyid yin na bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: because it is a special activity preceded by the permission to kill another.

original: mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the activity characterized by violence in a place that is not the place of sacrifice.

original: gang dag 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag pas kyang sdig che ba rig @216a * //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag pas kyang sdig che ba rig @216a * //
translated: Some say: The five heinous actions are the cause of hell.

original: byed smra ba'i tham lag gi rjes su zhugs nas /
analyzed: byed smra ba'i tham lag gi rjes su zhugs nas /
translated: and they follow the seal of the proponents of action.

original: mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tsho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ltar chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tsho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ltar chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: They say: The action that has the characteristic of harming in the context of sacrifice is not non-Dharma, just as the action that has the characteristic of sustaining life in the context of sacrifice is not non-Dharma.

original: bstan bcos las chos ma yin pa mi ston pa'i phyir dpe ma grub bo zhes zer ro /
analyzed: bstan bcos las chos ma yin pa mi ston pa'i phyir dpe ma grub bo zhes zer ro /
translated: The example is not established because the treatise does not teach non-Dharma.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten rgyang phan pa blo gros sbyang ba ma byas pa mi dge ba'i bya ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa gang yin pa de gtso cher sgrub par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten rgyang phan pa blo gros sbyang ba ma byas pa mi dge ba'i bya ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa gang yin pa de gtso cher sgrub par byed pa yin pas /
translated: These are the main practices of those who are worldly materialists, who have not trained their minds, and who delight in nonvirtuous action.

original: gtam 'dre bar bya ba yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gtam 'dre bar bya ba yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: They are not even suitable to be companions in conversation.

original: 'on kyang de dag gi lugs dgag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi lugs dgag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Nevertheless, their system should be refuted.

original: mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di la de'i gnas la 'bras bu ji lta bur mngon par sgrub par byed pa de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu tshe phyi ma la byed pa po la mngon par🔽sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di la de'i gnas la 'bras bu ji lta bur mngon par sgrub par byed pa de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu tshe phyi ma la byed pa po la mngon par sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Whatever action has the characteristic of harming living beings in a place of sacrifice, the agent will definitely obtain a result in the next life that is similar to the result that is obtained in this life in that place.

original: bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na sbyin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na sbyin pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a specific action, like giving.

original: gang dag 'di skad ces phyugs mchod sbyin du spyad pa ni chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad ces phyugs mchod sbyin du spyad pa ni chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say: Using cattle in sacrifice is not nonvirtuous because it is for their sake.

original: de'i ched yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi ched du sbyar ba de de'i ched du spyad pa chos ma yin pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur te /🔽dper na sbyin bdag gis bram ze'i ched du 'bras chan sbyar ba bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i ched yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi ched du sbyar ba de de'i ched du spyad pa chos ma yin pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur te / dper na sbyin bdag gis bram ze'i ched du 'bras chan sbyar ba bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That which is used for a specific purpose is not a cause of nonvirtue.🔽For example, it is like the cooked rice prepared by a donor for the sake of brahmans.

original: 'ga' zhig gis phyugs mchod sbyin gyi ched du sprul to zhes bya ba de mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis phyugs mchod sbyin gyi ched du sprul to zhes bya ba de mi 'grub ste /
translated: That is not good because it is not established that cattle were created for the sake of sacrifice.

original: sprul pa po 'ga' zhig gis blo sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: sprul pa po 'ga' zhig gis blo sngon du btang ste /
translated: Some emanations are preceded by a thought.🔽

original: byas par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some emanations do not accept that they are killed by others, because they have previously resolved to do so.

original: dud 'gro phyugs ngan 'gro log par ltung bar skyes pa bde ba shin tu dkon pa /
analyzed: dud 'gro phyugs ngan 'gro log par ltung bar skyes pa bde ba shin tu dkon pa /
translated: Animals are born in the lower realms, the miserable states, where happiness is very rare.

original: sha kho na med pa'i 'jigs skrag pa mya ngan bya bar 'os pa dag gsad pas /🔽lha lha'i phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / rgyan dang / gos 'chang ba'i gzugs can bdud rtsi mchog tu yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: sha kho na med pa'i 'jigs skrag pa mya ngan bya bar 'os pa dag gsad pas / lha lha'i phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / rgyan dang / gos 'chang ba'i gzugs can bdud rtsi mchog tu yid du 'ong ba /
translated: They are killed, even though they are frightened and deserve to be pitied, because they have no flesh.

original: ro zhim po'i zas za ba 'byor ba chen po dang ldan pa rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la su zhig yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ro zhim po'i zas za ba 'byor ba chen po dang ldan pa rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la su zhig yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Who would believe that the gods, who have the form of wearing divine garlands, ointments, ornaments, and clothes, who have the great prosperity of the most delightful and delicious food of nectar, would be delighted by the killing of animals?

original: phyugs dag ni mchod sbyin gyi chod ma yin te /
analyzed: phyugs dag ni mchod sbyin gyi chod ma yin te /
translated: Animals are not the sacrificial victims,

original: longs spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are to be enjoyed.

original: dper na mchod sbyin bya ba'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin bya ba'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the fruit of a sacrifice.

original: de bzhin du yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the extensive explanation of the inference should be stated, “Because of the reason of existence, etc.”

original: de ni phyogs tsam zhig nye bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni phyogs tsam zhig nye bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is merely an indication of the position.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression.

original: de'i phyir de ltar @216b thams cad mkhyen pa ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid phyin ci ma log par ston pa bka' lha dang mi'i bla ma rnams kyis bkur ba de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar @216b thams cad mkhyen pa ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid phyin ci ma log par ston pa bka' lha dang mi'i bla ma rnams kyis bkur ba de /
translated: Thus, the Omniscient One, who unerringly teaches that all things are essenceless, is the Teacher revered by gods and humans.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das stobs bcu mnga' ba yin no //🔽gtam ha cang 'phros pas chog gis /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das stobs bcu mnga' ba yin no // gtam ha cang 'phros pas chog gis /
translated: He alone is the Blessed One, the one who possesses the ten powers.🔽Enough of this digression.

original: skabs nyid la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs nyid la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Let us return to the topic at hand.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: khyed kyis chos thams cad spros pa med do zhes khas blangs la /
analyzed: khyed kyis chos thams cad spros pa med do zhes khas blangs la /
translated: “You accept that all phenomena are free of fabrication,

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes spros pa yang byed pas de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes spros pa yang byed pas de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: but you also fabricate the claim that all phenomena are empty. Therefore, your claim is undermined.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true.

original: gal te chos thams cad stong ngo //🔽zhes ma bstan par yang sgrub par byed pas /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong ngo // zhes ma bstan par yang sgrub par byed pas /
translated: If one could establish that all things are empty without teaching that they are empty,

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa med par chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa med par chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur na ni /
translated: then one could understand that all things are empty without the knowledge that comes from hearing the teachings.🔽But that is not the case.

original: don dam par /🔽stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod do //
analyzed: don dam par / stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate sense,🔽one should not say that they are empty,

original: mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //🔽gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
analyzed: mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing // gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
translated: nor should one say that they are not empty.🔽One should not say that they are both

original: da ltar ma yin pas /
analyzed: da ltar ma yin pas /
translated: nor should one say that they are neither.🔽Therefore, in order to help those who are practicing in accordance with the accumulations of merit and wisdom to understand this,

original: de'i phyir bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang rjes su mthun par sgrub par byed pa rnams kyis de ltar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang rjes su mthun par sgrub par byed pa rnams kyis de ltar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis /
translated: we say that the teachings on emptiness, etc.

original: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya //
analyzed: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya //
translated: are given for the purpose of designation.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par rtogs pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par rtogs pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are given in order to wash away the stain of false understanding.

original: de ltar re zhig lta ba'i ling tog gzhig pa'i phyir shes bya stong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig lta ba'i ling tog gzhig pa'i phyir shes bya stong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in order to destroy the cataract of wrong views, one should say that objects of knowledge are empty.

original: med par lta ba spang pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: med par lta ba spang pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In order to abandon the view of non-existence, one should say that it is not empty, by way of its nature as an illusion and a mirage.

original: don dam par rang las skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir gnyi ga zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par rang las skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir gnyi ga zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In order to abandon the view of both existence and non-existence, one should say that it is both, because it does not arise from itself ultimately, and because it arises by way of its nature as an illusion, etc.

original: gang yang rung ba'i mthar ltung ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir dang / bden pa gnyis la rnam par ltos pas gnyi gar lta ba'i skyon gyi dug bsal ba'i phyir dang / don dam par bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gnyi ga ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i mthar ltung ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir dang / bden pa gnyis la rnam par ltos pas gnyi gar lta ba'i skyon gyi dug bsal ba'i phyir dang / don dam par bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gnyi ga ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In order to abandon falling to an extreme of either of those, and in order to remove the poison of the fault of the view of both by way of dependence on the two truths, and in order to realize the truth of ultimate reality, one should say that it is neither.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yang dag pa ma yin par rtogs pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yang dag pa ma yin par rtogs pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to wash away the stain of incorrect understanding in that way,

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa brjod de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa brjod de /
translated: emptiness, etc. are expressed.

original: ji skad du stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “Emptiness is the relinquishment of all views.”

original: gzhan yang / gal te dngos po rang bzhin yod //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te dngos po rang bzhin yod //
translated: Moreover, if things have intrinsic reality,

original: stong mthong yon tan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: stong mthong yon tan ci zhig yod //
translated: what is the point of seeing emptiness?

original: rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
analyzed: rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
translated: Seeing that one is bound by conceptualization,

original: 'dir ni de nyid dgag par bya //
analyzed: 'dir ni de nyid dgag par bya //
translated: here that itself is to be refuted.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //🔽gal te gnyi @217a * //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // gal te gnyi @217a * //
translated: As this is explained.

original: ga ma yin no zhes spros par byed pas spros pa ma spangs so zhe na /
analyzed: ga ma yin no zhes spros par byed pas spros pa ma spangs so zhe na /
translated: If one were to elaborate, “It is not both,” then one would not have relinquished elaboration.

original: de las gzhan pa'i spros pa dag dgag par 'dod pas de skad smras kyang skyon med de /🔽dper na rang nyid sgra mi 'dod pas gzhan dag gi sgra dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i spros pa dag dgag par 'dod pas de skad smras kyang skyon med de / dper na rang nyid sgra mi 'dod pas gzhan dag gi sgra dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Although one says that in order to refute other elaborations, there is no fault,

original: sgra ma 'byin sgra ma 'byin zhes brjod pa la skyon med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra ma 'byin sgra ma 'byin zhes brjod pa la skyon med pa bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, when one does not assert sound oneself, but in order to refute the sound of others one says, “Do not make sound! Do not make sound!” there is no fault.

original: yang na don dam pa ston par byed pa'i rgyu'i shes pa tha snyad pa'i shes pa'i khyad par la don dam par nye bar gdags par byas nas /
analyzed: yang na don dam pa ston par byed pa'i rgyu'i shes pa tha snyad pa'i shes pa'i khyad par la don dam par nye bar gdags par byas nas /
translated: Or else, the ultimate is imputed to the special conventional consciousness that is the cause of teaching the ultimate.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams stong ngo zhes dam bcas pa'i phyir skyon med de /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams stong ngo zhes dam bcas pa'i phyir skyon med de /
translated: Since the thesis “Things are ultimately empty” is made in this way, there is no fault.

original: 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang /
translated: And later it says,

original: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
analyzed: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
translated: Without depending on the conventional,

original: dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The ultimate cannot be taught.

original: gzhan yang mi stong pa dgag pa kho na'i phyir stong pa nyid ces brjod par zad kyi stong pa nyid du sgrub pa gtso cher ma bstan pas skyon med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi stong pa dgag pa kho na'i phyir stong pa nyid ces brjod par zad kyi stong pa nyid du sgrub pa gtso cher ma bstan pas skyon med do //
translated: Moreover, since it is only in order to refute non-emptiness that emptiness is mentioned, and since the establishment of emptiness is not taught as the main point, there is no fault.

original: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid stong yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid stong yang /
translated: Therefore, although the essence of the Tathāgata is empty in this way,

original: gang dag 'di skad ces 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa de rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad ces 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa de rtag pa'am /
translated: those who say, “The Tathāgata is permanent in this way,

original: mi rtag pa'am /🔽rtag kyang rtag la /🔽mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'am / rtag kyang rtag la / mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa'am /
translated: impermanent,🔽both permanent and impermanent,

original: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa'am /
translated: neither permanent nor impermanent,

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten mtha' yod pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten mtha' yod pa'am /
translated: Likewise, the world would have an end,

original: 'jig rten mtha' med pa'am /🔽mtha' yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa'am /🔽mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' med pa'am / mtha' yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa'am / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: the world would not have an end,🔽the world would both have an end and not have an end,

original: mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: the world would neither have an end nor not have an end.

original: de dag ji ltar grub pa de bzhin du bdag kyang 'grub la /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar grub pa de bzhin du bdag kyang 'grub la /
translated: Just as those are established, so too would the self be established,🔽and so too would things be established.

original: dngos po rnams kyang 'grub bo zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyang 'grub bo zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir /
translated: In response to those who say this,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: we say:

original: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
translated: How could the four such as permanence, impermanence, and so on

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: exist in this peace?

original: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
translated: How could the four such as having an end, not having an end, and so on

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: exist in this peace?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa zhi ba 'di la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa zhi ba 'di la ste /
translated: The Tathāgata, who is peace, is not essentially arisen.

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs grub na de'i yang 'grub pa zhig na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs grub na de'i yang 'grub pa zhig na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: If the reason is established, then the statement “so too would the self be established” is a remainder of the words.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not a common attribute and is contradictory.

original: yang na bsgrub pa ji skad bstan pas /
analyzed: yang na bsgrub pa ji skad bstan pas /
translated: Or else, by the accomplishment as taught.🔽🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das brten nas gdags pa ngo bo nyid stong pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das brten nas gdags pa ngo bo nyid stong pa la /
translated: Or else, the Blessed One is established in the emptiness of intrinsic reality of dependent imputation.

original: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
translated: How could the four such as permanence,

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: impermanence, etc. exist in this peace?

original: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
translated: How could the four such as having an end,

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //🔽ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i zhi ba 'di la ste /
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod // ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i zhi ba 'di la ste /
translated: not having an end, etc. exist in this peace?🔽In this peace, which is the absence of intrinsic reality and the absence of substantial existence, the four such as permanence and impermanence do not exist.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi po de dag 'di la yod pa ma yin pa @217b nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don to //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi po de dag 'di la yod pa ma yin pa @217b nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the term.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is not permanent,

original: mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'am /
translated: impermanent,

original: rtag kyang rtag la /🔽mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa'am /🔽rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtag kyang rtag la / mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa'am / rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: both permanent and impermanent,

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa'am /
translated: or neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: 'jig rten mtha' yod pa'am /🔽mtha' med pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' yod pa'am / mtha' med pa'am /
translated: The world is not finite,🔽infinite,🔽both finite and infinite,

original: mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med pa'am /🔽mtha' yod pa yang ma yin //
analyzed: mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med pa'am /🔽mtha' yod pa yang ma yin //
translated: or neither finite nor infinite.

original: mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag ma yin te /
analyzed: mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag ma yin te /
translated: It is not finite, nor is it infinite.

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately the Tathāgata is non-arisen.

original: de ltar yang mdo sde las /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo sde las /
translated: Thus, a sūtra declares:

original: 'jam dpal skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, non-arisen and non-ceased

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: is a designation for the Tathāgata.”

original: gang dag 'di skad ces don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa kho na yin te /

analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa der ji ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa khams drug po dag yongs su brtags pa na dngos po yang ma yin /
translated: In this way, when the six elements such as space are imagined, they are neither things nor nonthings.

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /

original: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas /

analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /

original: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //

translated: and he is not a characteristic. Therefore, because of the non-entityness of things, non-things, bases of characteristics, and characteristics, he is identitylessness.

original: ji ltar skye mched brtag par skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de las ma gtogs pa'i lta ba po la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /

original: skye mched kyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: skye mched kyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: ji ltar me dang / bud shing brtag par gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid bkag pa de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin dus de bzhin du shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shes bya dang /
analyzed: ji ltar me dang / bud shing brtag par gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid bkag pa de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin dus de bzhin du shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shes bya dang /
translated: Just as in the Examination of Fire and Fuel, identity, difference, and inexpressibility are refuted, and they are devoid of intrinsic reality, in the same way, consciousness and its characteristics, the object of cognition and the cognizer,

original: 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dus pa can dang / chos kyi dbyings dag kyang gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dus pa can dang / chos kyi dbyings dag kyang gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas /
translated: the characteristics of the composite and the composite itself, and the dharmadhātu are devoid of the nature of identity, difference, and inexpressibility.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One is essenceless.

original: skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed pa skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / song ba dang / ma song ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed par song ba la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir /

original: skye ba la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas /
translated: arising and so on are essenceless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore the Thus-Gone One is essenceless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta bar 'gro ba 'di yang ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta bar 'gro ba 'di yang ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Just as the Thus-Gone One is, so too this world is essenceless.

original: de lta bas na mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there is no similar example,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: the meaning of the reason is not established and it is contradictory.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas /
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is this: By pointing out the faults of the proof presented by the opponent in the first chapter,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no //
translated: the dharmakāya of the Thus-Gone One is revealed.

analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid las med //

original: gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //

original: de phyir nyon mongs yang dag med //
analyzed: de phyir nyon mongs yang dag med //

analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub pa dpe mtshang ba'i skyon yod do //

analyzed: tha snyad pa'i dpes rtog na ni bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi lan gdab dka' ste /

analyzed: don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tha snyad pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /

analyzed: bdag gi yod nyid med nyid ni // don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi tshul la ltos nas /

analyzed: brtan pa ni rten yod na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
