original: sems kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i phyir dang / de rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pas sems ma grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang dag yod par smra ba dag na re 'di ltar kho bo cag ni gcig la gcig med pas /
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i phyir dang / de rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pas sems ma grub pa'i phyir ro // gang dag yod par smra ba dag na re 'di ltar kho bo cag ni gcig la gcig med pas /
translated: Because the arising of the mind is refuted, because the nature of consciousness is eliminated, and because the mind is not established by refuting its substantial existence.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par smra ba yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par smra ba yin pas /
translated: Those who advocate existence say: In this way, we advocate the absence of the characteristics of things because one does not exist without the other.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de grub pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de grub pas /
translated: Therefore, the afflictions do not exist.

original: sems las byung ba rnams la /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams la /
translated: The mental factors are related to the non-entityness of things.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa dang 'brel par yang grub par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa dang 'brel par yang grub par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, the non-entityness of things is established.

original: de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: In response to that, we say:🔽You assert that the pot and cloth do not have the characteristics of other things.

original: khyed bum pa dang / snam bu dag la de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po dang / dngos po med par snang ba'i blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'am /🔽dngos po med pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: khyed bum pa dang / snam bu dag la de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po dang / dngos po med par snang ba'i blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'am / dngos po med pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: Is that which is the cause of the arising of the cognition that perceives things and non-things a thing or a non-thing?

original: de la gal te dngos po yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: If it is a thing, then your thesis is undermined.

original: ci ste dngos po med pa yin na ni 'o na /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po med pa yin na ni 'o na /
translated: But if it is a non-thing, then🔽since there would be no connection between this blueness of this pot and this redness of that, there would be no conventions.

original: des na bum pa 'di'i sngo ba nyid dang / dmar ba nyid 'di'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir tha snyad med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: des na bum pa 'di'i sngo ba nyid dang / dmar ba nyid 'di'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir tha snyad med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore we say:

original: gal te gang med ci zhig yod //
analyzed: gal te gang med ci zhig yod //
translated: If something does not exist, how could something else exist?

original: rten bum pa'am /
analyzed: rten bum pa'am /
translated: The basis is either a pot or cloth.

original: snam bu gang zhig med par brten pa sngo ba nyid dam dmar ba nyid gcig yin par 'dod /
analyzed: snam bu gang zhig med par brten pa sngo ba nyid dam dmar ba nyid gcig yin par 'dod /
translated: What is the cloth that is supported by the absence of blue or red?

original: nyon mongs 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no affliction at all.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa la zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa la zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the non-entity, such as the son of a barren woman, is the example.

original: de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa @221a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa @221a * //
translated: But this is not accepted, therefore, the non-existent

original: dpe nyid du mi rung bas 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do //
analyzed: dpe nyid du mi rung bas 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do //
translated: is not suitable as an example. Thus, the intended meaning is not established.

original: rang gi sde pa rnams kyi phyir yang 'di bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa rnams kyi phyir yang 'di bshad par bya ste /
translated: This should be explained for the sake of our own schools as follows.

original: rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs rnams //
analyzed: rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs rnams //
translated: The afflictions are like the body.

original: rang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi'o //
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi'o //
translated: The word “own” refers to self and what belongs to self.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni ming dang / gzugs nye bar bsags pa'i rnams grangs so //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni ming dang / gzugs nye bar bsags pa'i rnams grangs so //
translated: The word “body” refers to the collection of name and form.

original: rang gi lus la lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi lus la lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “to view one’s own body”

original: rang gi lus la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba'o //
translated: refers to the afflicted view that takes one’s own body as its object.

original: rang gi lus la lta ba bzhin //
analyzed: rang gi lus la lta ba bzhin //
translated: The phrase “just as one views one’s own body”

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus la lta ba 'dra ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus la lta ba 'dra ste //
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //🔽de la sku med der de med //
analyzed: ji ltar sku min sku las gzhan ma yin // de la sku med der de med //
translated: The body is not the Tathāgata, nor is the Tathāgata other than the body.🔽The Tathāgata does not possess the body, nor does the body possess the Tathāgata.🔽The Tathāgata is not in the body, nor is the body in the Tathāgata.🔽The Tathāgata is not the body, nor is the Tathāgata otherwise than the body.🔽The Tathāgata is not the body, nor is the Tathāgata without the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: The Tathāgata is not the body, nor is the Tathāgata the possessor of the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
translated: What then is the Tathāgata?

original: zhes bya ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The afflictions are like that.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i don gyis nyon mongs par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i don gyis nyon mongs par byed pa dag go //
translated: The afflictions are so called because they afflict, that is, they harm.

original: nyon mongs can la rnam lngar med //🔽nyon mongs can gyi sems la ste //
analyzed: nyon mongs can la rnam lngar med // nyon mongs can gyi sems la ste //
translated: They do not exist in five ways in the afflicted.🔽They do not exist in five ways in the afflicted mind.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: The afflictions are not the afflicted mind,

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / sreg pa dang / bsregs pa dag gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / sreg pa dang / bsregs pa dag gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the negation of being other than that is excluded, and because it would follow, absurdly, that the burning and the fuel would be identical.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The afflictions are not other than the afflicted mind,🔽because it would follow, absurdly, that the afflictions would be permanent.

original: snga ma bzhin du de las gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams med par yang nyon mongs pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de las gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams med par yang nyon mongs pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as before, otherness is refuted, and because it follows that the afflicted would be afflicted even without the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can la med cing /🔽nyon mongs pa can yang nyon mongs pa rnams la med la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can la med cing / nyon mongs pa can yang nyon mongs pa rnams la med la /
translated: The afflictions do not exist in the afflicted,🔽and the afflicted does not exist in the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The afflictions are not possessed by the afflicted,

original: gzhan nyid med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can la rnam pa lngar med do //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can la rnam pa lngar med do //
translated: Thus the afflictions do not exist in the afflicted in five ways.🔽The afflicted does not exist in the afflictions

original: rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs can //
analyzed: rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs can //
translated: in five ways, like the body.

original: nyon mongs pa la rnam lngar med //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la rnam lngar med //
translated: The afflicted does not exist in the afflictions in five ways.

original: nyon mongs pa can nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lnga'i med pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lnga'i med pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The nonexistence of the afflicted in the afflictions should be applied in the same way.

original: de la nyon mongs pa rnams med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa rnams med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the afflictions do not exist there,

original: dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: The example is flawed because the property to be proven is incomplete.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
translated: when in our own system,

original: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / ngo bo nyid las yod min pa //
analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / ngo bo nyid las yod min pa //
translated: the attractive, unattractive, and mistaken do not exist by their very nature,🔽then at that time,

original: de'i tshe / sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten nas nyon mongs gang dag yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe / sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten nas nyon mongs gang dag yin //
translated: the afflictions that arise in dependence on the attractive, unattractive, and mistaken

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: are the remainder of the phrase “arise in dependence.”

original: de'i phyir don dam par nyon mongs pa @221b rnams kyi chos ni brten nas 'byung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par nyon mongs pa @221b rnams kyi chos ni brten nas 'byung ba ma yin pas /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, the phenomena of the afflictions do not arise in dependence,

original: dpe la bsgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: dpe la bsgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: so the example is flawed because the property to be proven is incomplete.

original: rang gi sde pa dag yang phyir bzlog par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag yang phyir bzlog par byed de /
translated: Our own schools respond to that by saying,🔽Form, sound, taste, tactility,

original: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang // dri dang chos dag rnam drug ni //
analyzed: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang // dri dang chos dag rnam drug ni //
translated: smell, and mental objects are the six.

original: rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: rnam pa drug go //
translated: They are the six types.

original: de dag ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gzhi ste 'di la gnas pas gzhi ste ;
analyzed: gzhi ste 'di la gnas pas gzhi ste ;
translated: They are the bases because they are the bases on which the afflictions are produced.

original: de dag las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they arise from those.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su rung ba'o //🔽sgra zhes bya ba ni bsgrag tu rung ba'o //🔽dri zhes bya ba ni bsnam du rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su rung ba'o // sgra zhes bya ba ni bsgrag tu rung ba'o // dri zhes bya ba ni bsnam du rung ba'o //
translated: The term form refers to that which is capable of materiality.🔽The term sound refers to that which is capable of being heard.

original: ro zhes bya ba ni myang du rung ba'o //
analyzed: ro zhes bya ba ni myang du rung ba'o //
translated: The term odor refers to that which is capable of being smelled.🔽The term taste refers to that which is capable of being tasted.

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni reg byar rung ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni reg byar rung ba'o //
translated: The term tangible refers to that which is capable of being touched.

original: chos dag ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dag ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term entity refers to that which is capable of holding its own characteristic.

original: rnam pa drug po de dag gang gi gzhi yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de dag gang gi gzhi yin zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of those six aspects?

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang dang / gti mug gir ni rnam par brtag /'dod chags ni chags par byed pa ste /🔽lhag par chags pa'o //🔽zhe sdang ni sdang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang dang / gti mug gir ni rnam par brtag /'dod chags ni chags par byed pa ste / lhag par chags pa'o // zhe sdang ni sdang bar byed pa ste /
translated: Desire, hatred, and delusion are imagined in relation to the pleasant, the unpleasant, and error.🔽Desire is the desire for union with an attractive object.

original: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Hatred is the desire to harm sentient beings.

original: gti mug ni rmongs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug ni rmongs par byed pa ste /
translated: Delusion is the desire for error.

original: mi shes pa'o ;
analyzed: mi shes pa'o ;
translated: It is ignorance.

original: /'dis ni phyin ci log gi chos ni gzhi yod pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: /'dis ni phyin ci log gi chos ni gzhi yod pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the basis of the three poisons is the false imagination.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log gang dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log gang dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, in reality, attachment and so on that arise in dependence on the error of the pleasant and the unpleasant do exist.

original: de dag gi gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their basis exists.

original: 'di na gang don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de la ni gzhi med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de la ni gzhi med de /
translated: Here, that which does not exist in reality has no basis,

original: dper na long ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na long ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the eye consciousness of a blind man.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag la ni gzhi phyin ci log dag tu rnam par brtag pa gang dag yin pa dag yod pas /🔽de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus phyin ci log dag yod pas de dag la brten nas ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag la ni gzhi phyin ci log dag tu rnam par brtag pa gang dag yin pa dag yod pas / de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus phyin ci log dag yod pas de dag la brten nas ;
translated: But for attachment and so on, the basis is the error that is imagined.🔽Therefore, by the power of the stated reason, since error exists, it is established that afflictions arise in dependence on it.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ba 'grub pas dpe'i skyon med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ba 'grub pas dpe'i skyon med do //
translated: Thus the example is not faulty.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:🔽Form, sound, taste, tactility,

original: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang // dri dang chos dag 'ba' zhig pa //
analyzed: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang // dri dang chos dag 'ba' zhig pa //
translated: smell, and mental objects alone,

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: “Only” means without intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dri tsam gyis kyang ma bsgos pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dri tsam gyis kyang ma bsgos pa dag yin no //
translated: They are not even slightly tainted by intrinsic reality.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa la skur ba 'debs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa la skur ba 'debs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they deny conventional reality,

original: 'di ltar de dag ni dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
translated: because they are like a city of gandharvas, like a mirage, like a dream.

original: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus nges pa dang / rgyud nges pa med par dmigs par bya ba nyid dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus nges pa dang / rgyud nges pa med par dmigs par bya ba nyid dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are like a city of gandharvas, because they are objects of perception without any definite place or time, and without any definite continuity.

original: smig rgyu 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin yang de la @222a * //
analyzed: smig rgyu 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin yang de la @222a * //
translated: They are like a mirage, because, although they are empty of intrinsic reality,

original: mngon par zhen pas yongs su tshol ba'i phyir rkyen gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas yongs su tshol ba'i phyir rkyen gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are the basis of conditions, because they are sought after by those who are attached to them.

original: rmi lam 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang re zhig par 'dod pas rgyu dang / 'bras bu sgrub pa'i dngos por nye bar 'gro ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang re zhig par 'dod pas rgyu dang / 'bras bu sgrub pa'i dngos por nye bar 'gro ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Like a dream” means that, although they are essenceless, they are similar to things that are established as causes and effects, because they are accepted as being for a while.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu dang / log par snang ba dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzugs brnyan 'dra ba de dag la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu dang / log par snang ba dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir ro // gzugs brnyan 'dra ba de dag la /
translated: Because form, etc., which are like that, are similar to the illusory person, and to false appearances.

original: byed pa po'i bya ba la mi ltos par skye ba nyid dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir / sdug pa dang ni mi sdug pa //
analyzed: byed pa po'i bya ba la mi ltos par skye ba nyid dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir / sdug pa dang ni mi sdug pa //
translated: “Like a reflection” means that they are similar to things that arise without depending on the activity of a creator.🔽Therefore,🔽how could there be

original: 'byung bar yang ni ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'byung bar yang ni ga la 'gyur // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the attractive and the unattractive?

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: They could not exist,

original: don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because they are empty of ultimate reality.

original: de'i phyir don dam par gzhi mi grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par gzhi mi grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid yod do //
translated: Therefore, because the basis is not ultimately established, the meaning of the reason is not established, and there is the contradiction of the meaning.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / gang la brten nas mi sdug pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang la brten nas mi sdug pa //
translated: in dependence on what is unattractive,

original: mi sdug pa zhes bya bar 'gyur pa'o //🔽mi sdug pa ni gdags bya ba //
analyzed: mi sdug pa zhes bya bar 'gyur pa'o // mi sdug pa ni gdags bya ba //
translated: what is unattractive is imputed.

original: mi sdug pa gang 'di ni mi sdug pa'o zhes mi sdug pa'i ngo bo nyid du'o bu cag gis gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa gang 'di ni mi sdug pa'o zhes mi sdug pa'i ngo bo nyid du'o bu cag gis gdags par bya'o //
translated: What is unattractive is imputed by us as having the nature of what is unattractive, saying, “This is unattractive.”

original: sdug pa ma ltos yod min pas //
analyzed: sdug pa ma ltos yod min pas //
translated: What is attractive does not exist without depending on what is unattractive.

original: sdug pa de mi sdug pa la ma ltos par sdug pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug pa de mi sdug pa la ma ltos par sdug pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is attractive does not exist as having the nature of what is attractive without depending on what is unattractive.

original: de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad ma yin //
translated: Therefore, what is attractive is not tenable.

original: mi sdug pa med pa'i phyir sdug pa yang de la ma ltos par sdug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa med pa'i phyir sdug pa yang de la ma ltos par sdug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because what is unattractive does not exist, what is attractive also does not exist as what is attractive without depending on it. This is what he intends.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽in dependence on what is attractive,

original: gang la brten nas sdug pa ni //
analyzed: gang la brten nas sdug pa ni //
translated: what is unattractive is imputed.

original: sdug pa zhes bya bar rab tu 'grub pa'o //🔽sdug pa zhes ni gdags bya ba //
analyzed: sdug pa zhes bya bar rab tu 'grub pa'o // sdug pa zhes ni gdags bya ba //
translated: The pleasant is established as just the pleasant.🔽The pleasant is designated as the pleasant.

original: sdug pa gang 'di ni sdug pa'o zhes sdug pa'i ngo bo nyid du'o bu cag gis gdags par bya'o //🔽mi sdug ma ltos yod min pas //
analyzed: sdug pa gang 'di ni sdug pa'o zhes sdug pa'i ngo bo nyid du'o bu cag gis gdags par bya'o // mi sdug ma ltos yod min pas //
translated: We designate the pleasant as the pleasant, as the nature of the pleasant.🔽The unpleasant is not established without depending on the pleasant.

original: mi sdug pa de sdug pa la ma ltos par mi sdug pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa med pas so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa de sdug pa la ma ltos par mi sdug pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa med pas so //
translated: The unpleasant is not established as the nature of the unpleasant without depending on the pleasant.

original: de phyir mi sdug 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir mi sdug 'thad ma yin //
translated: Therefore the unpleasant is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar sdug pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mi sdug pa yang sdug pa de la ma ltos par mi sdug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar sdug pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mi sdug pa yang sdug pa de la ma ltos par mi sdug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since the pleasant does not exist in that way, therefore the unpleasant also does not exist as the unpleasant without depending on the pleasant.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore,

original: sdug pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: sdug pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: since the pleasant does not exist,

original: 'dod chags 'byung bar ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'byung bar ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could attachment arise?

original: mi sdug yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mi sdug yod pa ma yin na //
translated: Since the unpleasant does not exist,

original: zhe sdang 'byung bar ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: zhe sdang 'byung bar ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could aversion arise?

original: de dag med pa'i phyir gti mug kyang med de /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir gti mug kyang med de /
translated: Since those do not exist, delusion also does not exist.

original: de @222b dag med pa kho nas de yang yod pa ma yin par grub bo //
analyzed: de @222b dag med pa kho nas de yang yod pa ma yin par grub bo //
translated: Since they do not exist, it is established that that also does not exist.

original: de dag brjod na skyon yod pa ma yin par grub na /
analyzed: de dag brjod na skyon yod pa ma yin par grub na /
translated: If it is established that there is no fault in stating them,

original: de dag brjod na skyon med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad bstan pa ldog pa med do /🔽// / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: de dag brjod na skyon med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad bstan pa ldog pa med do / // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu bdun pa /
translated: then since there is a fault in stating them, therefore the stated reason is not reversed.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: don dam par sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: “The errors of attraction and repulsion definitely exist ultimately,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are stated in the sūtras by the Transcendent Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mdo sde las gsungs pa de ni yod de dper na bdag med pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mdo sde las gsungs pa de ni yod de dper na bdag med pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: That which is stated in the sūtras by the Transcendent Lord exists, like selflessness.

original: mdo sde las /
analyzed: mdo sde las /
translated: In the sūtras it says:

original: mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang ; bdag med pa la bdag dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug par 'dzin pa ni phyin ci log go zhes gsungs pa de dag yod pas /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang ; bdag med pa la bdag dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug par 'dzin pa ni phyin ci log go zhes gsungs pa de dag yod pas /
translated: The Buddha has said that the four errors are to apprehend the impermanent as permanent, the nonself as self, suffering as happiness, and the impure as pure.

original: de'i phyir don dam par sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the errors of the beautiful and the ugly exist ultimately.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te 'ga' zhig log par sgrub pa yod na tha snyad pa'i sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag bsgrub pa la ni grub pa 'di rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig log par sgrub pa yod na tha snyad pa'i sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag bsgrub pa la ni grub pa 'di rung ngo //
translated: If there were any errors, then it would be correct to establish the conventional errors of the beautiful and the ugly.

original: don dam par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: don dam par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not correct ultimately.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: The Buddhas have said that neither

original: bdag med gang yang med par gsungs //
analyzed: bdag med gang yang med par gsungs //
translated: a self nor a selflessness exists.

original: zhes bya ba der lan btab zin pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der lan btab zin pas /
translated: We have already responded to this.

original: bdag skye ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do //
analyzed: bdag skye ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do //
translated: Since the self is not established as arisen, there is no example.

original: gtan tshigs kyang med de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang med de /
translated: There is also no reason.

original: don dam par mdo sde las /
analyzed: don dam par mdo sde las /
translated: In a sūtra it says:🔽“The world is confused,

original: phyin ci log dag yod par gsungs par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag yod par gsungs par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you do not accept that the Buddha has taught that the errors exist.

original: 'dir phyin ci log ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir phyin ci log ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, error is twofold:

original: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: in accordance with cyclic existence and in accordance with nirvāṇa.

original: de la 'khor ba dang / rjes su mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'khor ba dang / rjes su mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, that in accordance with cyclic existence is as follows:

original: mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: that which is impermanent is considered permanent, and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: That in accordance with nirvāṇa is as follows:

original: mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: that which is impermanent is considered impermanent, and so on.

original: de gnyi ga yang phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang phyin ci log ste /
translated: Both of these are errors,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pas spang bar bya ba yin te ;
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pas spang bar bya ba yin te ;
translated: because they are to be abandoned by attaining nonconceptual wisdom,

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the counteragents to that.

original: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa la /
translated: If, in regard to the impermanent, etc.,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir phyin ci log nyid yin par mi rigs so zhe na phyin ci log ces bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir phyin ci log nyid yin par mi rigs so zhe na phyin ci log ces bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of mistaken?

original: gal te mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes log par lta ba'i don to zhe na /🔽de'i @223a * //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes log par lta ba'i don to zhe na / de'i @223a * //
translated: If it means the meaning of the view that the impermanent is permanent,🔽then

original: phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: phyir bshad pa /
translated: in response to that, it is said:

original: gal te mi rtag rtag pa zhes //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag rtag pa zhes //
translated: If the impermanent is the permanent,

original: mi rtag pa rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa la rtag pa zhes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa la rtag pa zhes so //
translated: the impermanent is empty of permanence.

original: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //
translated: If apprehending it that way is mistaken,

original: de ltar shes pa phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa'i phyir phyin ci log yin na'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa'i phyir phyin ci log yin na'o //
translated: then apprehending it that way is mistaken because it observes the meaning of the mistaken.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: stod la rtag pa yod min pas //
analyzed: stod la rtag pa yod min pas //
translated: then since the permanent does not exist in the impermanent,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
translated: how is apprehending it that way not mistaken?

original: stong pa la rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa la rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since emptiness is also empty of permanence by its very nature,

original: stong pa la rtag par 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa la rtag par 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin te /
translated: how is apprehending emptiness as permanent not mistaken?

original: de ni phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /🔽dper na gal te khams gsum pa las /
analyzed: de ni phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te / dper na gal te khams gsum pa las /
translated: The meaning of the words is that it is not erroneous.

original: 'dod chags dang bral na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral na /
translated: For example, if one is free from attachment to the three realms,

original: ji ltar grol ba ma yin te grol ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grol ba ma yin te grol ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: how could one not be liberated? One would be liberated.

original: ji ltar don dam par stong pa la rtag pa nyid kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam par stong pa la rtag pa nyid kyang /
translated: How can one assert that emptiness in the ultimate sense is permanent

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong par 'dod ce na /
translated: by nature, even though it is empty?

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because it is unarisen, as previously explained,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no //
translated: it is like nirvana.

original: yang na / gal te mi rtag mi rtag ces //
analyzed: yang na / gal te mi rtag mi rtag ces //
translated: Or, if impermanence is impermanent,

original: mi rtag pa mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa la mi rtag pa zhes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa la mi rtag pa zhes so //
translated: impermanence is empty of impermanence.

original: de ltar 'dzin pa log min na //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa log min na //
translated: If one does not grasp it in that way,

original: de ltar shes pa phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin na'o //
translated: it is not erroneous, because such knowledge does not focus on an erroneous object.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: In that case,

original: stong pa mi rtag yod min pas //
analyzed: stong pa mi rtag yod min pas //
translated: since emptiness and impermanence do not exist,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
translated: how could grasping be erroneous?

original: stong pa la mi rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir stong pa la mi rtag par 'dzin pa yang ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa la mi rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir stong pa la mi rtag par 'dzin pa yang ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence is also empty of intrinsic reality in emptiness. Therefore, how could the apprehension of impermanence in emptiness be non-erroneous?

original: de yang phyin ci log nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the words is that this also is erroneous.

original: de'i chos ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: de'i chos ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because its property is conceptualization,

original: rtag par 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is like the apprehension of permanence.

original: de ltar na 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir pha rol po'i dam bcas pa'i don las bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir pha rol po'i dam bcas pa'i don las bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon te /
translated: Thus, here the meaning of the words is the opposite of the meaning of the opponent’s thesis because it is a statement that is open to dispute.

original: dper na / gal te bum pa byas pa mi rtag na /
analyzed: dper na / gal te bum pa byas pa mi rtag na /
translated: For example, if a pot is impermanent because it is produced,

original: sgra byas pa yang ci'i phyir mi rtag par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra byas pa yang ci'i phyir mi rtag par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: why is sound not impermanent because it is produced?

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de ni phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de ni phyin ci log yin te /
translated: Here the statement of the syllogism is: The cognition that form is impermanent ultimately is erroneous,

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is conceptualization.

original: dper na / gzugs rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / gzugs rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition that form is permanent.

original: gal te 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition that compounded phenomena are empty is indeterminate because it is associated with discursive thought,

original: de yang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: then there is no error because that is also erroneous.

original: gal te de lta na stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyang @223b thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyang @223b thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the wisdom of emptiness also does not bring about the attainment of liberation,

original: phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: because it is erroneous,

original: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi yul la bde ba la sogs par shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi yul la bde ba la sogs par shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like the cognition that the objects of the internal sense bases are blissful and so on.

original: 'dir dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: 'dir dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the thesis here?

original: gal te mig stong par shes pa thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te mig stong par shes pa thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the cognition that the eye is empty does not bring about the attainment of liberation, then that is to prove what is already established,

original: thad pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thad pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because liberation is attained through nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ci ste rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhe na ni /
analyzed: ci ste rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it is nonconceptual,

original: de phyin ci log gi shes pa nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de phyin ci log gi shes pa nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Because it is not established that that is a mistaken consciousness, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gal te stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that nonconceptual wisdom of emptiness also does not bring about the attainment of liberation,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because it is nonconceptual, like, for example, the eye consciousness of a child,

original: rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: then you have not ascertained the meaning of the reason.

original: 'gog pa shes pa bsgom pa las byung ba dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa bsgom pa las byung ba dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not ascertained by the meditation of the knowledge of cessation.

original: rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: You also have not established the meaning of the reason,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyang ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyang ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the wisdom of emptiness is conceptual because it is conceptual by nature.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang mi gnod de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang mi gnod de /
translated: Inference also does not undermine that,

original: rang la dpe med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang la dpe med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because you have no example.

original: gzhan yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: Moreover, what is the meaning of the statement, “It does not cause the attainment of liberation”?

original: gal te thar pa mi byed pa'o zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te thar pa mi byed pa'o zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If it means that it does not cause liberation, then that is established for us.

original: thar pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because liberation is not a product.

original: gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If it means that it does not know things as they are,

original: rang la ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang la ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: then that is not established for you.

original: mngon sum gyi blo dag gis ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo dag gis ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established by direct perception.

original: 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te /
translated: This also replies to those who say that nonconceptual knowledge is a mistaken consciousness,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes zer ba dag la yang lan btab par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes zer ba dag la yang lan btab par rig par bya'o //
translated: because it is nonconceptual, like visual consciousness.🔽If those who maintain that direct perception is conceptual say, “Direct perception is conceptual,

original: ji ste mngon sum gyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par smra ba dag 'di skad ces mngon sum gyi shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ste mngon sum gyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par smra ba dag 'di skad ces mngon sum gyi shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: because it is a consciousness,🔽like conceptual consciousness.”

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma yin pa'i phyir dper na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma yin pa'i phyir dper na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because they are consciousnesses and because they are valid cognitions, like the consciousness that is an inference.

original: de dag la yang /
analyzed: de dag la yang /
translated: To them we reply:

original: 'di skad ces lhas byin gyi mngon sum gyi blo ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ces lhas byin gyi mngon sum gyi blo ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te /
translated: The perceptual consciousness of Devadatta is nonconceptual,

original: mngon sum gyi gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / mig la brten pa'i phyir dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / mig la brten pa'i phyir dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: because it is the subject of the object form, and because it is based on the eye, like the eye consciousness of a child.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du ni shes pa de dag gis ma nges pa @224a * //🔽nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du ni shes pa de dag gis ma nges pa @224a * // nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, conventionally, those consciousnesses are not ascertained.

original: don dam par ni dpe med de /
analyzed: don dam par ni dpe med de /
translated: But ultimately, there is no example,

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dag kyang rab tu dben pa dang / ro gcig pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dag kyang rab tu dben pa dang / ro gcig pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the consciousnesses that are inferences and so forth are of one characteristic, because they are isolated and of one taste.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog pa dag gis skabs nyid kyi dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog pa dag gis skabs nyid kyi dbang du bya'o //
translated: We have explained enough about the incidental topics.

original: ji ltar mi rtag pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa phyin ci log yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa phyin ci log yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the grasping of the impermanent as permanent is an error,

original: bdag dang bde ba dang / sdug pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug par 'dzin pa dag kyang phyin ci log yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bde ba dang / sdug pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug par 'dzin pa dag kyang phyin ci log yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: so too should one say that the grasping of the self, of pleasure, of the beautiful, of purity, of the impermanent, of suffering, of the non-self, of the impure, and of the ugly is an error.

original: gzhan dag gis dam bcas pa'i don sgro btags nas smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis dam bcas pa'i don sgro btags nas smras pa /
translated: Others, having exaggerated the meaning of the thesis, say:

original: 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Grasping does exist,

original: de 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'dzin pa po dang gzung ba dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'dzin pa po dang gzung ba dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the grasper, the grasped, and grasping exist.

original: 'di na gang yod pa min pa de la ni gsum po de dag med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa min pa de la ni gsum po de dag med de /
translated: For, when something does not exist, these three do not exist.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the horn of a donkey.

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la ni shes pa gang gis 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'dzin pa po phung po'i bdag nyid dang / gzung ba la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la ni shes pa gang gis 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'dzin pa po phung po'i bdag nyid dang / gzung ba la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus /
translated: In the case of erroneous grasping, the grasper, the grasped, and so on exist by means of the cognition that grasps them, and the self that is the identity of the aggregates. Therefore, by the power of the reason stated,

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: But the grasping of what is nonexistent is not tenable.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:🔽The grasper, the grasped,

original: gang gis 'dzin dang 'dzin gang dang // 'dzin pa po dang gang gzung ba //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin dang 'dzin gang dang // 'dzin pa po dang gang gzung ba //
translated: the grasper, and that which is grasped

original: thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste //
analyzed: thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste //
translated: all are completely pacified.

original: de phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, grasping does not exist.

original: gang gis 'dzin par byed pa ni dngos po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin par byed pa ni dngos po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i shes pas so //
translated: The grasper is the consciousness that observes the specific and general characteristics of things.

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The grasped is the nature of superimposition and denial.

original: 'dzin pa po ni ming dang gzugs kyi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: 'dzin pa po ni ming dang gzugs kyi bdag nyid dam /
translated: The grasper is the nature of name and form,

original: de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: or it is different from that.

original: gang gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is grasped is form and so on.

original: de dag ni skabs ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid stong par bstan zin pas /
analyzed: de dag ni skabs ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid stong par bstan zin pas /
translated: They have already been shown to be empty of essence, just as the context demands.

original: des na 'dzin par byed pa la sogs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: des na 'dzin par byed pa la sogs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the grasper and all the rest are completely pacified.

original: de phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, grasping does not exist.

original: 'dzin pa bzhin du de dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i gtan tshigs dang // dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa bzhin du de dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i gtan tshigs dang // dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The reason and example that demonstrate the existence of those, like grasping, are not established.🔽This is the intended meaning.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore, it is like this:

original: log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //
analyzed: log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //
translated: Grasping as mistaken or correct

original: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: does not exist.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par ro //
translated: As permanent, impermanent, and so on.

original: 'o na don dam par /🔽gang la phyin ci log yod cing //
analyzed: 'o na don dam par / gang la phyin ci log yod cing //
translated: But ultimately,🔽where is there error?

original: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
translated: And where is there non-error?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas pa la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas pa la /
translated: For one abiding in the practice of nonconceptual wisdom,🔽the cognition of permanence, impermanence, and so on does not occur.

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par shes pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar @224b dgongs so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par shes pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar @224b dgongs so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: yang na gang dag 'di skad ces phyin ci log rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang dag 'di skad ces phyin ci log rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Or, those who say, Errors certainly exist,

original: de dang ldan pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who possesses them exists.

original: dper na gdugs dang ldan pa yod na /
analyzed: dper na gdugs dang ldan pa yod na /
translated: For example, if one who possesses an umbrella exists,

original: gdugs yod pa de bzhin du phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i byis ba 'di dag yod pas /
analyzed: gdugs yod pa de bzhin du phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i byis ba 'di dag yod pas /
translated: Just as there is an umbrella, so too there are these childish beings who possess error.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log rnams ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer na ;
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log rnams ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer na ;
translated: Therefore, error certainly exists.

original: de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /🔽log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de / log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //
translated: This is the reply to them.🔽There is no grasping

original: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: in terms of error or non-error.

original: rnam pa gnyi ga yang sngar bstan pa'i sgrub pas skye ba la sogs par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga yang sngar bstan pa'i sgrub pas skye ba la sogs par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both aspects are not established as arising and so on, as previously explained.

original: de bzhin du /🔽gang na phyin ci log dang ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du / gang na phyin ci log dang ni //
translated: Similarly,🔽Where is error?

original: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
translated: Where is non-error?

original: phyin ci log gang la ltos nas 'di ni phyin ci log dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gang la ltos nas 'di ni phyin ci log dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In dependence on error, one would say, “This one possesses error,”

original: 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba de dag kyang phyin ci log bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba de dag kyang phyin ci log bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: and “This one possesses non-error.” But just like error, they do not exist.

original: gang la phyin ci log yod pa dang / gang la phyin ci ma log pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log yod pa dang / gang la phyin ci ma log pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that where there is error and where there is non-error do not exist.

original: de'i phyir don dam par gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / dpe yang med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / dpe yang med la /
translated: Therefore, ultimately the meaning of the reason is not established, and there is no example.

original: kun rdzob tu don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: And, conventionally, the meaning is contradictory.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la phyin ci log dang ldan pa 'di ni phyin ci log dang bcas par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di la phyin ci log dang ldan pa 'di ni phyin ci log dang bcas par 'dod na /
translated: if you maintain that this one who possesses error possesses error,

original: de yang phyin ci log tu gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log tu gyur pa 'am /
translated: then that one who possesses error is either one who has error,

original: phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa'am /
translated: or one who does not have error,

original: phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba bzhin pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba bzhin pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: or one who is in the process of having error.

original: de la / phyin ci log tu gyur ba la //
analyzed: de la / phyin ci log tu gyur ba la //
translated: But,

original: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: Error is not possible🔽for one who has error.

original: de dag dang ldan pa la de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽phyin ci log tu ma gyur la /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa la de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // phyin ci log tu ma gyur la /
translated: Because it would be pointless for one who possesses error to possess error.🔽Error is not possible

original: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: for one who does not have error.

original: de dag dang bral ba'i phyir dper na 'phags pa bzhin no //🔽phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin la //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba'i phyir dper na 'phags pa bzhin no // phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin la //
translated: Because he is free from error, like an aryan.🔽Error is not possible

original: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: for one who is in the process of having error.

original: skyon gnyi gar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon gnyi gar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both errors would ensue.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa dang / phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba bzhin pa ma gtogs pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa dang / phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba bzhin pa ma gtogs pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa mi 'thad pas /
translated: Apart from the one who has error, the one who does not have error, and the one who has error, it is untenable that one who has error exists.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: khyod nyid phyogs su lhung ba'i blo med par gyis la /🔽gang la phyin ci log srid pa //
analyzed: khyod nyid phyogs su lhung ba'i blo med par gyis la / gang la phyin ci log srid pa //
translated: You should abandon the mind that falls into a position🔽and

original: bdag nyid kyis ni rnam par dpyod //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni rnam par dpyod //
translated: analyze for yourself🔽whether error is possible for one who has error.

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that one who has error does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon snga ma bzhin no //🔽gzhan yang / gang gi tshe don dam par ji skad bstan @225a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon snga ma bzhin no // gzhan yang / gang gi tshe don dam par ji skad bstan @225a * //
translated: Therefore, the errors of the reason and example are the same as before.

original: pa'i tshul gyi dbang gis dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: pa'i tshul gyi dbang gis dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when all things are shown to be unarisen by the power of the mode of positing the ultimate, as it has been explained,

original: phyin ci log rnams ma skyes na //🔽ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams ma skyes na // ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
translated: if errors are unarisen,🔽how could they exist?

original: yod par mi 'grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: yod par mi 'grub pa nyid de /
translated: They would not be established as existing.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to /🔽phyin ci log rnams skye med na //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to / phyin ci log rnams skye med na //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: because they do not arise.🔽If the errors do not exist,

original: phyin ci log can ga la yod //
analyzed: phyin ci log can ga la yod //
translated: how could there be one who is in error?

original: phyin ci log can zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyin ci log can zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One who is in error is one who possesses error.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid yod do //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the reason, etc. still remains.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: don dam par /
analyzed: don dam par /
translated: in reality,

original: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba yod na ni //
analyzed: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba yod na ni //
translated: if the self, the agreeable, the permanent, and the blissful existed,

original: bdag shes sdug shes rtag shes dang // de shes phyin ci log ma yin //
analyzed: bdag shes sdug shes rtag shes dang // de shes phyin ci log ma yin //
translated: then the cognition of the self, the agreeable, the permanent, and the blissful would not be erroneous.

original: shes bya phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: shes bya phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that because the object of cognition would not be erroneous.

original: 'dir bdag shes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni //🔽bdag la sogs pa de dag la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'dir bdag shes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni // bdag la sogs pa de dag la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Here, the words “cognition of the self,” etc.

original: bdag la sogs pa shes pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa shes pa yin par bstan to //
translated: indicate the cognition of the self, etc. because they are based on the self, etc.

original: de bzhin du don dam par /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par /
translated: In the same way, in reality,

original: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba med na ni //
analyzed: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba med na ni //
translated: If there is no self, no loved one, no permanence, and no pleasure,

original: bdag med mi sdug mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //🔽bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag la sogs pa brtsal bas sam /
analyzed: bdag med mi sdug mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no // bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag la sogs pa brtsal bas sam /
translated: then there is no selflessness, no ugliness, no impermanence, and no pain.🔽The nature of selflessness, etc., is established by the investigation of self, etc.,

original: de dag la ltos pas bdag med pa nyid la sogs par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag la ltos pas bdag med pa nyid la sogs par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: or by the dependence on those, because of the establishment of selflessness, etc.

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because selflessness, etc., are not established,

original: gang dag la bdag la sogs par lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag la bdag la sogs par lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur te /
translated: those who have the perverted views of self, etc.,

original: 'di ltar mi med na sdang dum la mir mthong ba'i phyin ci log kyang med do /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi med na sdang dum la mir mthong ba'i phyin ci log kyang med do /
translated: are like those who see a cairn as a man and are frightened.

original: phyin ci log nyid ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa med pa'i skyon de nyid bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa med pa'i skyon de nyid bzlog dka'o //
translated: Since the error of the perverted view is not established, it is difficult to avoid the error of the absence of reason, etc.

original: 'o na rnal 'byor pa de la de ltar rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log dang / phyin ci log ma yin pa dag grub pa'i phyir de dag tu rnam par rtog pa log par gyur ba na /
analyzed: 'o na rnal 'byor pa de la de ltar rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log dang / phyin ci log ma yin pa dag grub pa'i phyir de dag tu rnam par rtog pa log par gyur ba na /
translated: Well then, since for the yogi/nī, such as permanence and impermanence, are established as erroneous and non-erroneous, when the conceptualization of those is reversed,

original: yon tan ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what good qualities will arise?

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu bstan par bzhed pas /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu bstan par bzhed pas /
translated: With the intention to teach the result in the manner that has been taught,🔽it is said:

original: de ltar / phyin ci log 'gags pas /
analyzed: de ltar / phyin ci log 'gags pas /
translated: Thus, through the cessation of error,

original: ma rig pa ni 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: ignorance ceases.

original: phyin ci log dag gi rgyu yang ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log 'gags pas /
analyzed: phyin ci log dag gi rgyu yang ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log 'gags pas /
translated: Since the cause of error is ignorance, through the cessation of error,

original: bdag la sogs par lta ba'i rgyu ma rig pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs par lta ba'i rgyu ma rig pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: the cause of the view of self and so on, ignorance, ceases.

original: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni //🔽'du byed @225b la sogs 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni // 'du byed @225b la sogs 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: When ignorance ceases,🔽formations and so on cease.

original: 'du byed la sogs pa zhes bya bar tshig sbyar te /
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa zhes bya bar tshig sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “formations and so on” is to be applied.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la sogs pa dag go //

original: de'i phyir de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rtogs pa las nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba 'grub po //🔽ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs 'di la nyon mongs pa de dag yod par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rtogs pa las nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba 'grub po // ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs 'di la nyon mongs pa de dag yod par gyur pa'am /

original: med par gyur pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: med par gyur pa zhig yin grang na /

analyzed: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //

analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid yod na //

analyzed: yod par gyur ba'i zhes ma smos kyang /

analyzed: skabs las shes par bya'o // ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //

analyzed: ji ltar spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na /

original: yod pa su zhig spong bar byed //
analyzed: yod pa su zhig spong bar byed //

analyzed: yod par gyur pa ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //

analyzed: ji ste med par gyur pa ni ri bong gi rva lta bu'am /

analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa'i mtshan nyid lta bu yin na de lta na yang /
translated: then even so,

analyzed: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //

analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid med na //

original: 'dir yang med par gyur pa zhes ma smos kyang /
analyzed: 'dir yang med par gyur pa zhes ma smos kyang /
translated: Here, although “what does not exist” is not mentioned,

original: skabs las shes par bya'o //🔽ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skabs las shes par bya'o // ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //
translated: it should be understood from the context.🔽How could they be abandoned?

original: ji ltar spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could they not be abandoned?

original: med pa su zhig spong bar byed //
analyzed: med pa su zhig spong bar byed //

analyzed: med par gyur pa'i med pa nyid ni spang du med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i ngo bo nyid spong bar mi byed la / rta ngo bo nyid med pas kyang /

analyzed: spong bar 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam na / yod par gyur pas gang gi gnyen po skyes pas /

analyzed: de la 'dir nyon mongs pa rnams yod par gyur pa dang / med par gyur par rtog pa la de dag spong ba mi 'thad pas /

analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med de /

original: spang pa yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: spang pa yin pa'i phyir dper na /

analyzed: skyon rtog pa la @226a * //

original: de dag spong ba yod do //
analyzed: de dag spong ba yod do //

analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni /

analyzed: pha rol pos smras pa'i bsgrub pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / rang gi sgrub pa kha na ma thob med pa bstan pas /

original: phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //

original: kun nas dmigs su med pa ltar //
analyzed: kun nas dmigs su med pa ltar //
translated: It is not apprehended as a whole.

original: de ltar nyon mongs gzugs can min //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs gzugs can min //
translated: Just so, the afflictions are not physical,

original: gtan du dmigs su yod ma yin //
analyzed: gtan du dmigs su yod ma yin //
translated: And they do not exist as permanent realities.

original: ji ltar ngag 'di yod pa min //
analyzed: ji ltar ngag 'di yod pa min //
translated: Just as this speech does not exist,

original: nang dang phyi na mi gnas ltar //
analyzed: nang dang phyi na mi gnas ltar //
translated: It does not exist internally or externally.

original: de ltar nyon mongs yod min pa //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs yod min pa //
translated: Just so, the afflictions do not exist,

original: nang dang phyi na gnas pa min //
analyzed: nang dang phyi na gnas pa min //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du sha ra dva ti'i bu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: And so on. And likewise, O Śāradvatī­putra, the thorough knowledge of the afflictions is just as it is.

original: de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ga' yang med de /

analyzed: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: phyin ci log gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de la yod pa'i yongs su 'grub pa'am /

original: mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med de /

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni /

original: rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing bstan te /

original: gzugs su mi snang yang kun du mkhyen la /
analyzed: gzugs su mi snang yang kun du mkhyen la /

original: gnyis su ma mdzad kyang /
analyzed: gnyis su ma mdzad kyang /

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /

analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /

analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa'o /

analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis /

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: khyod kyis bstan pa'i tshul gyis /

analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //

analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //

translated: because they are empty, like, for example, a sky-flower.”

analyzed: de'i phyir skyon 'di lta bur 'gyur te /

analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang med pas /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams /

analyzed: khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur //

translated: Therefore, those who are afraid of death and who are yogis should understand the four noble truths, abandon them, actualize them, and meditate on them.

analyzed: kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba'i mngon par brtson pa gang yin pa de mi 'thob pas /

analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas /

analyzed: yongs su shes dang spang ba dang // bsgom dang mngon du bya ba dag /'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ni / 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa'am / 'phags par byed pa'i bden pa'am /
translated: The so-called “noble truths”🔽are the truths of the noble ones,

analyzed: 'phags pa yang yin la / bden pa yang yin pas 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // bden pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or they are the truths that make one noble,🔽or they are noble and truths.

analyzed: yang dag pa dang / ma nor ba zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //

analyzed: 'dir bsgom pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba gnyis bsnor ba ni /
translated: Here, the two, cultivation and manifestation, are combined

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa @227a * //

original: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //

analyzed: zhugs pa dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i lam la gnas pa dag go //

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi tshogs 'gro ba'i bsod nams kyi zhing bdud la sogs pas mi phyed cing /

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jogs  pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jogs  pas /
translated: and it is not led by others.

original: bsdus pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'jig rten na mtshan dge 'dun zhes bya bar rnam par grags pa yang med par 'gyur bas /

analyzed: gal te skyes bu gang zag brgyad //

analyzed: de dag med na dge 'dun med //

analyzed: gang dag lam dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas rnam par bshad pa dag go //

analyzed: gzhan yang / 'phags pa'i bden rnams med pa'i phyir //

analyzed: de lam la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni lam gyi bden pa'o //

analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad las thugs su chud pa'i phyir /

analyzed: nyan thos la bstan pa dang rjes su mthun pas sangs rgyas kyang 'grub ste /

analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
