original: chos thams cad ni sngon gyi drang srong rnams kyis gsungs pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sngon gyi drang srong rnams kyis gsungs pas /
translated: All Dharmas were taught by the ṛṣis of the past.

original: sangs rgyas snga ma rnams kyis gsungs pa nyid rjes su ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //🔽sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas snga ma rnams kyis gsungs pa nyid rjes su ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so // sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
translated: The Buddha teaches only what was taught by the Buddhas of the past.

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: The Buddha has not taught any Dharma to anyone anywhere.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos rnams bdag nyid de dang / de dag gis gtan du stong pa'i phyir chos gang zhig shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nam spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi ngo bo nyid gang gis bdag nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba'i chos de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos rnams bdag nyid de dang / de dag gis gtan du stong pa'i phyir chos gang zhig shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nam spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi ngo bo nyid gang gis bdag nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba'i chos de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since no phenomenon exists that is an object of a consciousness that has the nature of a specific characteristic or a universal characteristic, no phenomenon exists that is apprehended by itself.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad las blangs pa'i chos de ni 'ga' yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad las blangs pa'i chos de ni 'ga' yang ma mchis te /
translated: Bhagavat, the Dharma that the Tathagata received from the Tathagata Dipankara does not exist at all.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni gzung du ma mchis shing brjod du ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzung du ma mchis shing brjod du ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are ungraspable and inexpressible.

original: 'dir mu stegs can ngan pa spobs pa rlom pa dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam pa thams cad du gsal bar byed pa theg pa mchog gi tshul gyis dpa' bkong ba /
analyzed: 'dir mu stegs can ngan pa spobs pa rlom pa dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam pa thams cad du gsal bar byed pa theg pa mchog gi tshul gyis dpa' bkong ba /
translated: Here, the bad extremists, who are arrogant with their own theories, are frightened by the method of the supreme vehicle, which illuminates the nature of things in every way.

original: ngan g-yo'i rjes su 'jug pa dag gis rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i skyon bcab pa'i phyir smras pa /🔽sangs rgyas rnam rtog med pa yi //
analyzed: ngan g-yo'i rjes su 'jug pa dag gis rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i skyon bcab pa'i phyir smras pa / sangs rgyas rnam rtog med pa yi //
translated: Those who follow the deceitful say:

original: theg pa chen po mi rung ste //
analyzed: theg pa chen po mi rung ste //
translated: The Great Vehicle is not suitable🔽For the Buddha who is without conceptualization,

original: gang phyir don dam sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: gang phyir don dam sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: Because the ultimate Buddha

original: chos ni bstan pa ma byas phyir //
analyzed: chos ni bstan pa ma byas phyir //
translated: Did not teach the Dharma.

original: sprul sangs rgyas kyi'ang mi rung ste //
analyzed: sprul sangs rgyas kyi'ang mi rung ste //
translated: It is also not suitable for the emanation Buddha,

original: de la sems can sogs med phyir //
analyzed: de la sems can sogs med phyir //
translated: Because there are no sentient beings, etc.

original: de phyir sprul pa sangs rgyas min //
analyzed: de phyir sprul pa sangs rgyas min //
translated: Therefore, the emanation is not the Buddha,

original: des ni chos kyang bstan ma byas //
analyzed: des ni chos kyang bstan ma byas //
translated: And he did not teach the Dharma.

original: don dam du ni mi rtog pa'i //
analyzed: don dam du ni mi rtog pa'i //
translated: In the ultimate sense,

original: stong la snying rje mi 'dod de //🔽gang la snying rje byed pa yi //
analyzed: stong la snying rje mi 'dod de // gang la snying rje byed pa yi //
translated: Compassion is not desired in emptiness,

original: sems can med phyir sangs rgyas med //
analyzed: sems can med phyir sangs rgyas med //
translated: Because there are no sentient beings🔽Who are the objects of compassion, therefore there is no Buddha.

original: gal te kun rdzob snying rje yod //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob snying rje yod //
translated: If there is conventional compassion,

original: smad 'tshod du bar byed dang 'dra //
analyzed: smad 'tshod du bar byed dang 'dra //
translated: It is like a prostitute’s love.

original: smad 'tshong rnams kyi dud mo gang //
analyzed: smad 'tshong rnams kyi dud mo gang //
translated: Whatever is the weeping of prostitutes,

original: de ni kun rdzob snying rje min //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob snying rje min //
translated: That is not conventional compassion.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de la 'dir don dam pa'i mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyang yod pa ma yin /🔽theg pa chen po yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir don dam pa'i mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyang yod pa ma yin / theg pa chen po yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, since there is no characteristic of the ultimate, even buddhahood does not exist due to the sameness of characteristics.

original: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir /🔽kho bo @241a * //
analyzed: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir / kho bo @241a * //
translated: The Mahāyāna also does not exist because the ultimate is the domain of nondual wisdom.

original: cag gi tshul nyid smras par gyur to //
analyzed: cag gi tshul nyid smras par gyur to //
translated: We have spoken of our own system.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par mi rtog pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par mi rtog pa las kyang /
translated: Also, from the nonconceptuality of the Tathāgata’s body,

original: sprul pa'i skus thams cad la phan 'dogs par bzod pa gzhan la phan pa dang / bde ba bsgrub pa'i thugs dam gyis yongs su bsgos pa nyid dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis rnam pa thams cad du 'byung ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i skus thams cad la phan 'dogs par bzod pa gzhan la phan pa dang / bde ba bsgrub pa'i thugs dam gyis yongs su bsgos pa nyid dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis rnam pa thams cad du 'byung ste /
translated: the nirmāṇakāya is the patience that benefits all, completely suffused with the commitment to accomplish the benefit and happiness of others, and it arises in every way through the power of previous aspirations.

original: de la brten nas yi ge dang ngag dang tshig rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsung chos dang / gang zag bdag med par mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yin nam sangs rgyas thams cad dang / thun mong ma yin pa rnams gsal bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: de la brten nas yi ge dang ngag dang tshig rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsung chos dang / gang zag bdag med par mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yin nam sangs rgyas thams cad dang / thun mong ma yin pa rnams gsal bar mdzad pa /
translated: On the basis of that, he taught the Dharma, which has the characteristic of being in accord with the letters, speech, and words, and he clarified the selflessness of persons for the tīrthikas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas and for all the buddhas, who are not in common with those.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir theg pa mchog gis 'gro ba rnams la nye bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir theg pa mchog gis 'gro ba rnams la nye bar 'byung ste /
translated: On the basis of that, the speech of the Buddha, which has the characteristic of being in accord with the letters, speech, and words of beings, and which elucidates the selflessness of persons for tīrthikas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas and the unshared for all buddhas, arises for those who go by the supreme vehicle in order to perfectly accomplish the perfections.

original: de ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the Mahāyāna.

original: don dam pa pa'i sangs rgyas yod na bstan pa brjod pa'i gsung 'byung ba'i phyir ston pa yang bstan pa dag gi mdzad pa po nyid du 'dod pa kho na yin pas grags pa'i gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i sangs rgyas yod na bstan pa brjod pa'i gsung 'byung ba'i phyir ston pa yang bstan pa dag gi mdzad pa po nyid du 'dod pa kho na yin pas grags pa'i gnod pa yang med do //
translated: If the ultimate Buddha exists, the speech that expresses the teaching arises, and therefore the Teacher is asserted to be the agent of the teaching. Therefore there is no fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged.

original: ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: But if someone thinks that the teaching of the Tathāgata is the conceptualized Tathāgata, the agent,

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid yin na gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir dper na nyan thos la sogs pa'i bstan pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid yin na gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir dper na nyan thos la sogs pa'i bstan pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /
translated: because it is the characteristic of sound, it arises by the power of the thought of another, like the teaching of the śrāvakas and so on,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: sprul pa bstan pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: sprul pa bstan pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan pa mi rung ste /
translated: Because the teaching of the emanations is not definite.🔽This also refutes the objection that the teaching is not possible in the absence of conceptualization,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpog pa la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpog pa la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no //
translated: because it is nonconceptual, like a donkey.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don rang la ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don rang la ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the reason is not unestablished for oneself.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa gtan tshigs nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes phyir zlog par byed na yang lan snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa gtan tshigs nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes phyir zlog par byed na yang lan snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If you respond by saying that the meaning of the reason is not unestablished because the establishment of the position of the other party is itself the reason, then the response is the same as before.

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas las gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir tha snyad pa'i sangs rgyas nyid zlog par mi byed do //🔽des bstan pa yang zlog par mi byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas las gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir tha snyad pa'i sangs rgyas nyid zlog par mi byed do // des bstan pa yang zlog par mi byed do //
translated: You do not refute the conventional Buddha because the emanation Buddha is not to be described as different from the ultimate Buddha.

original: don dam pa pa'i sangs rgyas ni gsung gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du mdzad pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i sangs rgyas ni gsung gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du mdzad pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You do not refute the teaching of the emanation Buddha because the ultimate Buddha is the cause of speech and because he is established as the one who performs the conventional action of teaching.

original: don dam par ni de @241b bzhin gshegs pa la spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni de @241b bzhin gshegs pa la spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: In the ultimate truth, the Tathāgata does not have conceptual elaborations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje mi mnga' ba'am /🔽thugs rje dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje mi mnga' ba'am /🔽thugs rje dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have compassion.🔽The Tathāgata has compassion.

original: thugs rje dang thugs rje'i gnas sems can med pa'i phyir thugs rje yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: thugs rje dang thugs rje'i gnas sems can med pa'i phyir thugs rje yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, compassion does not exist, nor does one who possesses it.

original: de dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin pas 'di yang kho bo cag gi tshul nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin pas 'di yang kho bo cag gi tshul nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this also clarifies our own system.

original: kun rdzob tu ni kho bo cag la sems can dang / thugs rje yang yod pas gzhi de las bcom ldan 'das kyang yod de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni kho bo cag la sems can dang / thugs rje yang yod pas gzhi de las bcom ldan 'das kyang yod de /
translated: We do accept that conventionally, sentient beings and compassion exist, and therefore, the Bhagavat exists on that basis.

original: de'i dbang gis sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub pa'i thugs dam bzhes pa yin par grub 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub pa'i thugs dam bzhes pa yin par grub 'dod do //
translated: It is established that he has a commitment to accomplish various kinds of benefit and happiness for sentient beings through the power of his compassion.

original: de la thugs rje ni gzhan sdug bsngal bas thugs thag pa nas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la thugs rje ni gzhan sdug bsngal bas thugs thag pa nas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Compassion is defined as the suffering of the mind of another from suffering,

original: dper na ma bu la byams pa /
analyzed: dper na ma bu la byams pa /
translated: just as a mother loves her child,

original: bu gcig pa la ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang sems can thams cad la de bzhin no //
analyzed: bu gcig pa la ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang sems can thams cad la de bzhin no //
translated: just as a mother loves her only child, so also the buddhas and bodhisattvas love all sentient beings.

original: gal te smad 'tshong ma la yod par gyur na yang de la mi dgar ci yod /
analyzed: gal te smad 'tshong ma la yod par gyur na yang de la mi dgar ci yod /
translated: If it were to exist in a prostitute, what is there to be unhappy about?

original: de lta mod kyi ba spu'i khung bu dang / nam mkha'i khams dag mtshan nyid 'drar zin kyang /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ba spu'i khung bu dang / nam mkha'i khams dag mtshan nyid 'drar zin kyang /
translated: Even though the pores of the body and the realm of space have the same characteristics,

original: khyad par shin tu che ba de bzhin du che /
analyzed: khyad par shin tu che ba de bzhin du che /
translated: the difference between them is very great.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje yang smad 'tshong ma'i dud mo lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje yang smad 'tshong ma'i dud mo lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The compassion of the Bhagavat is not like the weeping of a prostitute,

original: bskal pa stong phrag dpag tu med pa nas yongs su bsgom pa nyid kyis rab tu mthar phyin par gyur pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi khams ma lus pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa stong phrag dpag tu med pa nas yongs su bsgom pa nyid kyis rab tu mthar phyin par gyur pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi khams ma lus pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is perfected by cultivation over countless thousands of eons and because it pervades the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: ci ste bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje'i mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa de smad 'tshong ma la med na ni /
analyzed: ci ste bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje'i mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa de smad 'tshong ma la med na ni /
translated: If the characteristic of the compassion of the Bhagavat, as it has been described, does not exist in a prostitute,

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje ni smad 'tshong ma'i dud mo dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje ni smad 'tshong ma'i dud mo dang 'dra ste /
translated: then the compassion of the Bhagavat is like the weeping of a prostitute.

original: gal te kun rdzob snying rje yod //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob snying rje yod //
translated: If there were conventional compassion,

original: smad 'tshong du bar byed dang 'dra //
analyzed: smad 'tshong du bar byed dang 'dra //
translated: it would be like the weeping of a prostitute.

original: zhes smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje ni thugs thag pa nas ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje ni thugs thag pa nas ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the Buddha’s compassion is not from the depths of his heart,

original: kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir dper na smad 'tshong ma'i dud mo bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir dper na smad 'tshong ma'i dud mo bzhin no zhe na /
translated: but is conventional, like the lust of a prostitute,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is not good.

original: bu la byams pa la sogs pa'i snying rje dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu la byams pa la sogs pa'i snying rje dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not certain that compassion is not from the depths of the heart, as in the case of love for a son, and so on.

original: de'i phyir mu stegs can dag ni rab tu zhe sdang ba'i sgregs pa dring ba'i tshig kun du brjod pa na rang gi bsam pa'i bdag nyid ngan pa nyid du ston @242a * //🔽par byed pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir mu stegs can dag ni rab tu zhe sdang ba'i sgregs pa dring ba'i tshig kun du brjod pa na rang gi bsam pa'i bdag nyid ngan pa nyid du ston @242a * // par byed pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, when the tīrthikas utter the words of their evil, hateful, and contemptuous speech, they reveal their own evil intentions.

original: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /
translated: The Lamp of Wisdom, commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way

original: bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: NINETEENTH CHAPTER

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa po dag gis smras pa /🔽dmigs pa thams cad nyer zhi zhing //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa po dag gis smras pa / dmigs pa thams cad nyer zhi zhing //
translated: The Yogācāras say:🔽All reference points are completely pacified,

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ste //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ste //
translated: and elaborations are completely pacified.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
translated: The Buddha has said that nirvāṇa🔽is the pacification of all elaborations.

original: su la 'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la 'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: No one has taught any Dharma to anyone.

original: zhes bya ba ni bden na de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang la skur ba 'debs pa de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bden na de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang la skur ba 'debs pa de ni mi rung ste /
translated: If that is true, then it is not right to deny the other-dependent, which is the means of understanding that reality.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: ngo bo nyid gsum shes par bya //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum shes par bya //
translated: The three natures should be understood.

original: dang po kun du brtags pa yin //
analyzed: dang po kun du brtags pa yin //
translated: The first is the imagined.

original: gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang yin te //
analyzed: gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang yin te //
translated: The second is the other-dependent.

original: tha ma yongs su grub pa yin //
analyzed: tha ma yongs su grub pa yin //
translated: The third is the consummate.

original: mtshan nyid de bzhin skye ba dang // don dam ngo bo nyid med pas //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de bzhin skye ba dang // don dam ngo bo nyid med pas //
translated: Because of the characteristic, the arising, and the ultimate realitylessness,

original: ngo bo nyid ni gsum po dag / ngo bo nyid med nyid du 'dod //🔽de la gang gi tshe kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gsum po dag / ngo bo nyid med nyid du 'dod // de la gang gi tshe kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
translated: The three natures are considered realityless.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu mtshan du mi 'dzin pas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu mtshan du mi 'dzin pas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe na /
translated: When the imagined nature is not perceived because it does not exist and the other-dependent nature is not seen because it is not apprehended as a sign,

original: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin no //
translated: then all objectification is completely pacified.

original: de dag lhan cig tu 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig tu 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed together with them.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de gang yin /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de gang yin /
translated: What is this so-called imagined identity?

original: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni ji lta bu yin /
translated: How is it identityless due to identitylessness of characteristics?

original: gal te kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par la sogs par tha snyad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gal te kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par la sogs par tha snyad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The imagined identity is the conceptualization that is the cause of the conventional expressions of the natures and attributes, etc. of phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of nature is the conceptualization of form, feeling, etc.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ni bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ni bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of attributes is the conceptualization of such things as “it has resistance” and “it does not have resistance,” “it is visible,” “it is not visible,” etc.

original: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni rgyu mtshan la sogs pa lnga po dag gi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni rgyu mtshan la sogs pa lnga po dag gi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is identityless due to identitylessness of characteristics because it is not included among the five, such as the causal sign.

original: de de ltar yod pa ma yin yang ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de ltar yod pa ma yin yang ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Although it does not exist in that way, it is thoroughly afflicted due to the engagement of name and meaning.

original: ji ltar ming don la 'jug pa de ltar byis pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ming don la 'jug pa de ltar byis pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen par byed do zhe na /
translated: How is it that childish beings conceive the entity of that name?

original: de la 'dir gal te gzugs zhes bya bar yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa'i kun brtags pa ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de med do zhe na ni dngos po la skur ba 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir gal te gzugs zhes bya bar yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa'i kun brtags pa ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de med do zhe na ni dngos po la skur ba 'debs pa yin te /
translated: Here, if you say that the imagined identity that is the mental expression and verbal expression of “form” does not exist, then you deprecate things,

original: yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa la @242b skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa la @242b skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you deprecate mental expression and verbal expression.

original: ci ste gang yang rung bas de gnyis kyi don kun brtags pa gang yin pa de med de /
analyzed: ci ste gang yang rung bas de gnyis kyi don kun brtags pa gang yin pa de med de /
translated: If you say that the imagined object of either of those two does not exist,

original: dper na thag pa la sbrul bzhin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sbrul bzhin no zhe na ni /
translated: like a snake in a rope,

original: kun brtags pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: then the imagined does not not exist.

original: de la rnam pa 'dra bas blo gros 'khrul pas kun brtags pa'i don med kyang tha snyad du sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhe na ni /
analyzed: de la rnam pa 'dra bas blo gros 'khrul pas kun brtags pa'i don med kyang tha snyad du sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhe na ni /
translated: In that case, if one says that the coiled rope is without snake, because the object imagined by the erroneous cognition is non-existent, due to the similarity of the aspects,

original: grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is the fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged.

original: ci ste don dam par dngos po sel bar byed na ni /
analyzed: ci ste don dam par dngos po sel bar byed na ni /
translated: But if one refutes entities in the ultimate,

original: dbu ma pa'i tshul gyis rjes su smra ba yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i tshul gyis rjes su smra ba yin te /
translated: then one is merely repeating the Madhyamaka method,

original: don dam par sbrul rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par sbrul rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the snake does not exist substantially in the ultimate, and because there is no arising from self.

original: thag pa dang sbrul 'khyil ba la mi dmigs pa kho nar thag pa dang sbrul gyi blo skye na ni /
analyzed: thag pa dang sbrul 'khyil ba la mi dmigs pa kho nar thag pa dang sbrul gyi blo skye na ni /
translated: If the cognition of snake and rope arises only in the non-apprehension of rope and coiled snake,

original: pha rol po rang la shes par byed pa rab tu ma grub bo //
analyzed: pha rol po rang la shes par byed pa rab tu ma grub bo //
translated: then the opponent’s own knowledge is not established.

original: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya ba der tha snyad kyi dus su ni phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'dod par bya'o zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya ba der tha snyad kyi dus su ni phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'dod par bya'o zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that at the time of conventional usage, a proof that is acknowledged by both parties should be accepted.

original: kun brtags pa'i don yod pa ma yin par ston par 'dod pas ni slob dpon gyis dbu ma pa'i tshul 'thad pa dang bcas pa bka' stsal pa nyid 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i don yod pa ma yin par ston par 'dod pas ni slob dpon gyis dbu ma pa'i tshul 'thad pa dang bcas pa bka' stsal pa nyid 'dod par bya ste /
translated: One who wishes to demonstrate that the object of the imagined is not existent should accept the master’s statement of the Centrist system as correct,

original: brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa kho nas yul de la yid dang tshig gi brjod pa 'jug pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa kho nas yul de la yid dang tshig gi brjod pa 'jug pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by the mere negation of the reality of the object of expression, the engagement of mental and verbal expression in that object is stopped.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med do zhe na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med do zhe na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: If one says that the imagined characteristic does not exist, the meaning of the reason is not established,

original: ming ni gzugs dang 'du byed du gtogs pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa rnam par rtog pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs dang 'du byed du gtogs pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa rnam par rtog pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the name belongs to the form and formation aggregates, and because the intrinsic natures, concepts, and memory-cognitions belong to the consciousness and formation aggregates.

original: gzhan yang tha snyad pa'i brjod pa 'jug pa ni brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi yul can yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha snyad pa'i brjod pa 'jug pa ni brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi yul can yin la /
translated: Moreover, the engagement of conventional expression has as its domain the reality of the object of expression and its distinctions.

original: don dam par brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par bkag pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: don dam par brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par bkag pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa mi 'thad de /
translated: Because the ultimate reality of the object to be expressed and its distinctions are refuted, the afflictions of clinging are untenable.

original: skyes bu 'phyon ma pas gzugs su byas pa'i na chung la bdag med pa nyid du rtog pa bzhin pas ming gi dbang gis don la mngon par zhen par mi rigs te /
analyzed: skyes bu 'phyon ma pas gzugs su byas pa'i na chung la bdag med pa nyid du rtog pa bzhin pas ming gi dbang gis don la mngon par zhen par mi rigs te /
translated: It is like a man who has sex with a young girl made of wood, imagining her to be a real girl. Therefore, it is not reasonable to cling to the meaning of a word as real,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las rigs so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las rigs so //
translated: because it arises from improper mental activity.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang gang yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang gang yin /
translated: Similarly, what is the so-called dependent nature?

original: chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam @243a * //🔽par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam @243a * // par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the basis of the dependent origination of phenomena, the basis of affliction and purification.

original: brtags pa'i rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the imagined and its sign, because the two do not exist elsewhere, and because of the observation of affliction,

original: gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: the dependent is accepted as existent.

original: 'di la yang gal te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs par 'dod na ni de 'dod la rag ste de ston pa don med do //
analyzed: 'di la yang gal te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs par 'dod na ni de 'dod la rag ste de ston pa don med do //
translated: Here, if you assert that the nature of another is included in conventional truth, then that is accepted, but it is pointless to teach it.

original: ci ste don dam par na ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste don dam par na ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: But if it is in the ultimate, then it is not dependently arisen.

original: skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par bstan pa'i tshul gyis skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //🔽brtags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // zhes bya ba de yang phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par bstan pa'i tshul gyis skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro // brtags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // zhes bya ba de yang phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because arising is refuted by the method taught in the chapter on nonarising.🔽And because of the imputation and its reason,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: this is also the nonestablishment of the meaning of the reason because it is not the property of the subject.

original: ci ste yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang /
translated: But if you say,🔽“Because of the imputation and its reason,”

original: brtags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // zhes bya ba 'dir chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin pas de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par gzugs zhes brtags pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: brtags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // zhes bya ba 'dir chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin pas de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par gzugs zhes brtags pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: then since this is a statement of an example that shares a property, therefore the inference is that whatever is imputed as form in the ultimate is only imputed together with its reason.

original: brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes rjod par byed na yang dper na 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes rjod par byed na yang dper na 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: If you say, “Because it is investigated,” then, since there is no example, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reason is also contradictory.

original: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang dag don dam par ming dang gzugs skye ba med do zhes dam bcas pa de la dam bcas pa'i skyon 'dogs par byed pa de dag / gal te rjes su dpag pas gnod pa smra na de nyid kyi phyir de la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa
analyzed: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir ro // gang dag don dam par ming dang gzugs skye ba med do zhes dam bcas pa de la dam bcas pa'i skyon 'dogs par byed pa de dag / gal te rjes su dpag pas gnod pa smra na de nyid kyi phyir de la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa
translated: Because the reason is stated generally.🔽Those who find fault with the thesis that ultimately name-and-form are unborn, if they say that it is undermined by inference, then, precisely because of that, it is not undermined by inference.

original: med do // ci ste grags pas gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: med do // ci ste grags pas gnod do zhe na /
translated: If they say that it is undermined by what is commonly accepted,

original: de ni dang po nyid du lan btab zin to //
analyzed: de ni dang po nyid du lan btab zin to //
translated: we have already responded to that above.

original: ci ste mngon sum gyis gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mngon sum gyis gnod do zhe na /
translated: If they say that it is undermined by direct perception,

original: de yang 'dir skabs med do //
analyzed: de yang 'dir skabs med do //
translated: that is also not relevant here.

original: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the ultimate is nondual.

original: ci zhig gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci zhig gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur /
translated: What is it that is defiled and purified?

original: don dam par skye ba med par smra ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skur ba 'debs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med par smra ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la skur ba 'debs pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who maintain that ultimately there is no arising do not deny defilement and purification.

original: skur ba 'debs pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skur ba 'debs pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: But they do deny them!

original: 'di ltar mdo sde las /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde las /
translated: For a sutra declares:

original: thog ma med pa'i dus ldan khams //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus ldan khams //
translated: The element that has existed since beginningless time

original: sa bon kun gyi gnas yin te //
analyzed: sa bon kun gyi gnas yin te //
translated: is the abode of all seeds,🔽and through its existence all the worlds

original: de yod pas ni 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de yod pas ni 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: and the attainment of nirvana are possible.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang yin par 'dod de /
translated: Thus they assert that the dependent nature exists.

original: de yang dag na ni chos kyi dbyings @243b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang dag na ni chos kyi dbyings @243b zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is pure, it is called the ultimate expanse.

original: ma dag na ni nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: ma dag na ni nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: If it is impure, it is called the afflicted class.

original: mdo sde las de skad gsungs pa ni tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs gsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo sde las de skad gsungs pa ni tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs gsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The statement in the sutra is made in order to clarify the system of conventional truth.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus ldan khams //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus ldan khams //
translated: The element that has existed since beginningless time

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because consciousness has been operating since beginningless time.

original: khams zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khams zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The element is so called because it is the cause of the noble dharmas.

original: gser dang dngul gyi khams bzhin no //
analyzed: gser dang dngul gyi khams bzhin no //
translated: It is like the element of gold and silver.

original: sa bon kun gyi gnas yin te //
analyzed: sa bon kun gyi gnas yin te //
translated: It is the abode of all seeds.

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum par gtogs pa dang / ma gtogs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum par gtogs pa dang / ma gtogs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the abode of the seeds of the propensities for both the wholesome and the unwholesome that are included in the three realms and not included in the realms.🔽Because of its existence, all migrations

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis 'gro ba 'thob par byed pa'i chos mngon par 'du byed na'o //
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis 'gro ba 'thob par byed pa'i chos mngon par 'du byed na'o //
translated: are so called because one creates the dharmas that cause one to obtain the migrations under its influence.

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: One attains nirvana.

original: zhes bya na ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba skye ba med pa shes pa nyid kyis mi skye ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir zhes bya bar tshigs su bcad pa'i don khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya na ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba skye ba med pa shes pa nyid kyis mi skye ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir zhes bya bar tshigs su bcad pa'i don khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that, then you accept the meaning of the verse, because you would attain nirvana, which is a nonarising phenomenon, through the knowledge of nonarising that arises from hearing, contemplation, and meditation.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don gzhan yin par ni tshad ma dag gis bstan dka' ba'i phyir des ni lan mi thebs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don gzhan yin par ni tshad ma dag gis bstan dka' ba'i phyir des ni lan mi thebs so //
translated: But if you say that the meaning of the verse is different, then you cannot respond to the objection, because it is difficult to demonstrate that meaning with valid cognition.🔽If you say that the dependent is real

original: ci ste yang mdo sde las /
analyzed: ci ste yang mdo sde las /
translated: because a sutra says,

original: brtags pa'i dngos po med pa nyid //
analyzed: brtags pa'i dngos po med pa nyid //
translated: “The nonexistence of the imputed🔽and the existence of the dependent

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa yin //🔽sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba'i mthar //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa yin // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba'i mthar //
translated: are to be understood.🔽One who conceives of them

original: rtog par byed pa nyams par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pas /🔽gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rtog par byed pa nyams par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pas / gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: falls to the extremes of superimposition and deprecation.”

original: mdo sde'i don ni gzhan gyi dbang la ming yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi dbang yang tha snyad du //
analyzed: mdo sde'i don ni gzhan gyi dbang la ming yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi dbang yang tha snyad du //
translated: Then we reply that the meaning of the sutra is that the dependent does not exist by way of names and that the dependent exists conventionally.

original: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bu'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyid gsal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bu'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyid gsal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: It is the selflessness of phenomena that is the emptiness of the entity of the object of knowledge, which is the object of the wisdom of meditative equipoise of the Superiors.

original: gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang /
translated: It is also stated in other scriptures:

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
translated: Whatever names there are

original: chos rnams gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos rnams gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: For whatever phenomena there are,

original: de la de ni yod min pa //
analyzed: de la de ni yod min pa //
translated: They do not exist in them,

original: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
translated: And that is the reality of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: bskyed bya med cing skyes pa med //🔽rkyen rnams dag ni gang dag kyang //
analyzed: bskyed bya med cing skyes pa med // rkyen rnams dag ni gang dag kyang //
translated: There is nothing produced and nothing that produces,

original: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod pa min //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod pa min //
translated: And there are no conditions at all anywhere.

original: tha snyad du ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: tha snyad du ni brjod par bya //
translated: But they are to be expressed conventionally.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: gang la cung zad skye med cing //
analyzed: gang la cung zad skye med cing //
translated: In whatever is not produced in the least

original: 'gag pa'ang cung zad yod min pa //
analyzed: 'gag pa'ang cung zad yod min pa //
translated: And does not cease in the least,

original: 'gro ba dben mthong de la ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba dben mthong de la ni //
translated: Seeing the world as void,

original: yod pa nyid dang med nyid med //🔽ces bya ba la @244a * //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang med nyid med // ces bya ba la @244a * //
translated: There is neither existence nor nonexistence.

original: sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: khyed cag chos kyi khams ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar ston /
analyzed: khyed cag chos kyi khams ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar ston /
translated: You teach how the element of dharmas is defiled and how it is purified.

original: chos kyi khams nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la /
analyzed: chos kyi khams nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la /
translated: The element of dharmas is not to be described as either defiled or undefiled.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma glo bur ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma glo bur ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the stains of affliction are adventitious.🔽Like the water element, gold, and space,

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' dag / dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' dag / dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: it is held to be pure when cleansed.

original: de ji ltar nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not to be described as either defiled or undefiled?

original: gal te nyon mongs de ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs de ma gyur //
translated: If it were not afflicted,

original: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
translated: all embodied beings would be liberated.

original: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
translated: If it were not pure,

original: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //
translated: endeavors would be fruitless.

original: yang na / nyon mongs ma yin mi mongs min //
analyzed: yang na / nyon mongs ma yin mi mongs min //
translated: Or, it is not afflicted, not unafflicted,

original: de ni dag min ma dag min //
analyzed: de ni dag min ma dag min //
translated: not pure, not impure.

original: sems ni rang bzhin 'od gsal phyir //
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin 'od gsal phyir //
translated: Because the mind is luminous by nature

original: nyon mongs glo bur yin phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs glo bur yin phyir ro //
translated: and because afflictions are adventitious.

original: de ni rigs pas ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni rigs pas ma yin te //
translated: But that is not logical.

original: bdag tu smra ba dag gis kyang //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag gis kyang //
translated: Even the proponents of a self

original: gal te nyon mongs bdag ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs bdag ma gyur //
translated: say that if the self were not the appropriator,

original: lus can thams cad grol bar gyur //
analyzed: lus can thams cad grol bar gyur //
translated: then all embodied beings would be liberated.

original: gal te rnam dag bdag ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te rnam dag bdag ma gyur //
translated: And if the self were not pure,

original: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //
translated: then effort would be fruitless.

original: de'i phyir re zhig bdag rtag pa dag pa byed pa med pa yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig bdag rtag pa dag pa byed pa med pa yod de /
translated: Therefore, the self is permanent, pure, and inactive,🔽but still cyclic existence and liberation exist.

original: 'on kyang 'khor ba dang thar pa dag kyang yod do zhes de ltar phyir zlog par byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor ba dang thar pa dag kyang yod do zhes de ltar phyir zlog par byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is possible to refute the objection.

original: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i skyon sba ba'i thabs 'thad pa med pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i skyon sba ba'i thabs 'thad pa med pa mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the method of concealing the faults of your philosophy is not established.

original: gzhan yang chu la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba'i khyad par bsten pa dag bzhin du tha snyad pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dngos por skye ba la ltos pas nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang chu la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba'i khyad par bsten pa dag bzhin du tha snyad pa'i rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dngos por skye ba la ltos pas nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang /
translated: Moreover, just as water and so on arise due to the power of causes and conditions, conventional consciousness arises as afflicted or unafflicted things in dependence on objects.🔽Thus, it is suitable for the phenomena element to arise simultaneously with afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams med par phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bdag tu 'byung bar 'gyur bar rung ba de ltar chos kyi khams ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams med par phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bdag tu 'byung bar 'gyur bar rung ba de ltar chos kyi khams ni /
translated: to arise simultaneously with unmistaken consciousness without afflictions, and to arise as afflicted and completely purified.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ma yin pas chu la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ma yin pas chu la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: Since it does not arise simultaneously with consciousness and afflictions, like water and so on,

original: de bzhin nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag tu 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag tu 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: it is not suitable for suchness to become afflicted or completely purified.

original: gal te du ba dang / khug rna la sogs pa yod pa dang / med pa nam mkha'i dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med par brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te du ba dang / khug rna la sogs pa yod pa dang / med pa nam mkha'i dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med par brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it said that smoke, mist, etc. are either existent or nonexistent, and that the sky is either soiled or not soiled?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not said.

original: nam @244b mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam @244b mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the substantial reality of space has been refuted.

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa dag mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid yin na yang dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa dag mi 'grub ste /
translated: And even if it were substantially real, it would not be established as either soiled or unsoiled.
